title: Senior Product Designer, Admin Experience
description:
**About the team & opportunity**  

  

What's so great about working on Calendly's Product team? We strive to design a seamless product experience that delights our customers.



Why do we need you? Well, we are looking for a Senior Product Designer for our Admin Experience team who can deeply understand the unique needs of our admin users and design a delightful experience that drives both admin and end-user success. You will be responsible for designing simple & intuitive experiences that our users will love and you will partner with our incredible data and engineering teams to see that your solutions can get realized.


#### **A day in the life of a Senior Product Designer, Admin Experience at Calendly**



The Design Team at Calendly is a tight knit group of creatives who work closely with product management, content design, research, and engineering to craft amazing experiences for our users. We believe that great design starts with talking with our users, and that the best solutions come from interdisciplinary collaboration.



Calendly is scaling its offerings in ways that will impact the efficiency of millions of people around the world. This is an opportunity to join a team and lead efforts that will face these challenges head-on.


**On a typical day, you will be working on:**


* Designing exceptional experiences that focus on our three pillars:  

**Organizing permissions:** Understanding and scaling the permissioning and roles for objects, people, and information across our product  

**Daily team management:** Optimizing existing experiences to better solve for the needs of admins in the day-to-day management of their team  

**Ongoing Set-up:** identifying new opportunities that lead to a more complete and efficient set-up for admins and their teams  

**First time user experience and activation:** providing insight into admin-specific needs as it relates to first time user experience and activation
* Drive discovery work to build personas and user journeys
* Partner with customer success to deeply empathize with the target users and their unique pain points and opportunities
* Partner with designers, product managers, engineers, content designers, and researchers to improve and refine the Calendly experience
* Partner with the design system team to improve design patterns
* Engage with customers to ensure that they are usable

#### **What do we need from you?**


* 5+ years building and delivering experiences for digital products in product-led B2B or B2C companies.
* A strong portfolio of work delivering quality persona-based experiences, including both activation and engagement
* An expert ability to communicate design solutions to leaders and peers, based on the right mix of customer needs and key business metrics
* A demonstrated understanding of the levers that balance business goals, team processes, and user needs, and how they affect the production of usable design systems.
* Authorized to work lawfully in the United States of America as Calendly does not engage in immigration sponsorship at this time

#### **What's in it for you?**



Ready to make a serious impact? Millions of people already rely on Calendly's products, and we're still in the midst of our growth curve — it's a phenomenal time to join us. Everything you'll work on here will accelerate your career to the next level. If you want to learn, grow, and do the best work of your life alongside the best people you've ever worked with, then we hope you'll consider allowing Calendly to be a part of your professional career.


#### **Our Hiring Process:**



We aim to provide an inclusive and equitable candidate experience to everyone who expresses interest in working at Calendly. To learn more about our hiring process, please visit our careers page at www.careers.calendly.com.



Once selected for an opportunity, the recruiter assigned to the role will keep you informed every step of the way. Have questions? Let your recruiter know! Want to share your experience? We are passionately committed to improving and building on our process, and we consider feedback a gift.


***If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the application or recruiting process, please contact us at recruiting@calendly.com .***


***Calendly is registered as an employer in many, but not all, states. If you are located in Hawaii, Montana, New Mexico, North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska, Kansas, Iowa, West Virginia, and Rhode Island, you will not be eligible for employment. Note that all individual roles will specify location eligibility.***


***All candidates can find our Candidate Privacy Statement*** ***here***


***Candidates residing in California may visit our Notice at Collection for California Candidates here:*** ***Notice at Collection***



Compensation is based on a variety of factors including but not limited to location, experience, and job-related skills. In addition, Calendly offers a wide range of best in class **total rewards**. This includes comprehensive employee benefits like healthcare, dental, vision, parental leave, 401(k) match, paid time off, and much more. At Calendly we believe exceptional performance deserves exceptional rewards! During the hiring process, we are committed to sharing details about the compensation range for the position, enabling you to make an informed decision.



Please note that the compensation details listed in role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus/commission, equity, or benefits.

 **Base Pay Range California - Salary**


$154,700—$209,300 USD

title: Lead UX Designer
description: This individual will play a pivotal role in defining the user experience for a loan origination platform and customer-facing tools and applications. They will make complex business processes and capabilities into simple and efficient experiences for employees and customers. Responsibilities: • Collaborate closely with product managers, business analysts, developers, and other stakeholders to define requirements and create impactful solutions. • Participate in the product strategy process including planning, brainstorming, and road mapping by providing design and UX input in ideation and decision-making forums. • Conceptualize and create wireframes, prototypes, and user flows to effectively communicate design concepts. • Conduct usability testing and gather feedback to iteratively refine designs. • Participate in establishing and maintaining design systems to ensure consistency and scalability across all applications. • Work closely with our technology partners to implement designs and ensure alignment with design specifications and User Centered design best practices and methodologies. • Be an advocate for Human-Centered Design principles, unafraid to ask questions and ready to take risks that deliver value for users. • Give and solicit feedback from other designers and partners through regular reviews, critique, and workshops. • Mentor and guide junior designers, contributing to their professional growth and team success. Requirements: • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Design, Interaction Design, Human-Computer Interaction or related field or equivalent professional experience. • 6+ years of hands-on experience designing and building web and mobile experiences. • Strong portfolio demonstrating an outcome-focused, innovative design process. • Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Sketch, etc. • Working knowledge of front-end concepts for dialog with engineering partners. • Proven track record of working in Agile environments, delivering high-quality designs within sprint timelines. • Experience with generative research and creating solutions supported by strategic insights. • Experience with evaluative testing methodologies and User Testing or similar tools to conduct tests. • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to engage effectively with cross-functional teams. • Experience building inclusive, accessible experiences and WCAG 2.2 guidelines. Preferred: • Previous experience in the financial industry, especially lending. • Previous experience working on complex, internal business apps with high information density. • Strong team player with exceptional empathy and a positive attitude. • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects concurrently.

title: Graphic and Web Designer

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
**Job Title:** UI/UX Designer

**Department:** Design

**Location:** Remote

**Reports To:** Lead UI/UX Designer or Design Director

**Overview**

Ethics Professionals Game Corporation is looking for a UI/UX designer to join our team and create engaging and user-friendly interfaces for our games. As a UI/UX designer, you will be responsible for researching user needs, designing intuitive visuals, and working closely with cross-functional teams to bring your designs to life. If you have a passion for creating exceptional user experiences and have the skills to bring innovative designs to life, we invite you to apply!

**Responsibilities**

* **Conceptualization and Design:** Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to effectively communicate design ideas and visualize user flows.
* **User-Centric Focus:** Conduct user research, gather feedback, and analyze data to inform design decisions, ensuring our games are designed with the player experience in mind.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with product managers, developers, artists, and other stakeholders to understand requirements, ensure design feasibility, and maintain consistency throughout the development process.
* **Iterative Approach:** Iterate on designs based on user feedback and usability testing, constantly striving to improve the overall experience.
* **Industry Awareness:** Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in UI/UX design.
* **Documentation:** Contribute to the creation and maintenance of UI/UX design guidelines and documentation.

**Qualifications**

* **Experience:** Proven experience as a User Interface Designer or similar role, with a focus on game UI/UX being a strong plus.
* **Design Proficiency:** Demonstrated proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator), Figma, Sketch, or similar.
* **Technical Skills:** Solid understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript. Familiarity with prototyping tools (e.g., UXPin, Axure) is a plus.
* **Agile Methodology:** Experience working in an Agile environment and understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC).
* **Visual Excellence:** Exceptional visual design skills with a keen eye for detail and aesthetics.
* **Team Player:** Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment.
* **Communication:** Strong communication skills to effectively present and articulate design concepts.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience with front-end frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).
* Knowledge of Unreal Engine or other game development platforms.

**To Apply**

If you're passionate about games and creating exceptional user experiences, please send your resume, portfolio demonstrating your UI/UX game design work, and a brief cover letter to ethicsprofessionals@progameco.us. We look forward to hearing from you!

**Ethics Professionals Game Corporation is an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment.**

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Are you passionate about making a difference in people's lives? Do you enjoy working in a service-oriented industry? If so, this opportunity may be the right fit for you!
Modivcare is looking for an experienced UX/UI Designer. In this role, you will help establish the user experience by designing digital features and products for Modivcare. You will work with other UX/UI Designers, Delivery teams, and team members to help guide the company in accomplishing the vision for a bold and cohesive user experience across all products. You will report to a Director or Manager of Software Engineering.*Please note this is an "Evergreen" position which is used to build our candidate pool but is not a role that is open at this time. That said, we encourage you to apply to be a part of our talent community. By having your information on file, we can reach out to you when this (or a similar role) officially opens.*
You will...* Implement creative design deliverables for web-based and mobile platforms. Designs will address aspects of high-level interaction, navigation, and organization across one or more assigned platforms to satisfy user goals and improve engagement.
* Handoff designs to your Delivery Team(s), including such formats as wireframes, mock-ups, functional demos, presentations, and annotated specifications.
* Work with your Product Owner to conduct user research efforts, including: surveys, usability studies, design thinking sessions, and competitive research.
* Present research findings and design work to peers, partners, and executives for review and feedback, explaining how design solution answers user needs, business goals, technical constraints, and other project facets.
* Revise and iterate designs and documentation based on continued user testing and feedback.
* Enforce UX/UI design consistency across platforms.


We are interested in speaking with individuals with the following...* Bachelor's degree, certificate from a UX/UI program, or equivalent experience.
* 3+ years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, visual designer, or similar UX/UI-related role.
* Experience with the following:
	+ Figma
	+ Zeplin
	+ Adobe Creative Cloud
* Knowledge of eCommerce, mobile app, industry trends, and competitor innovations.
* Can work with geographically distributed teams.
* Can present and "sell" creative ideas to influence decisions.
* Knowledge of inclusive design principles, accessibility standards, and general design best practices.
* Can provide a portfolio/work examples that highlight design process.

title: Lead Product Designer, 12-month Contract
description:
#### **Why Glassdoor?**



Our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. In the process, we're transforming the workplace experience through the power of transparency and further cementing ourselves as the worldwide leader in employer branding and insights. By choosing a career at Glassdoor, you'll be directly contributing toward our vision for a world where transparency empowers the workforce and motivates companies to become better employers.

 **About The Role**



The Community Product Design team is looking for a Contract Lead Product Designer with a social media background who's excited to craft experiences that will engage users and foster a supportive, professional community. We need a contract teammate who knows how to marry function and fun, and who can offer creative, innovative solutions that fit into the long-term vision for the product. We're seeking someone with a collaborative leadership mentality, who's not afraid to dive in, take charge, and leverage their design expertise to craft best-in-class experiences.



You will collaborate with designers, researchers, developers, and product managers to design user-focused surfaces and systems across web and app. This is a twelve month contract opportunity with a target start date of April 1, 2024. There may be opportunities for contract extension or conversion to a full-time role based on performance and business needs, but it cannot be guaranteed.



To succeed in this role, you should have a solid grasp of the social media space, UX process, system thinking, attention to detail, and a strong portfolio showcasing your customer-centric experiences across a range of touch-points. Familiarity with Figma is required. You should feel comfortable presenting your work, advocating for your choices, and explaining your thinking while maintaining an open mind.



As part of our Product Design team, you will have the opportunity to share your knowledge and expertise, making a lasting impact on our platform's success. With every interaction, you'll leave your mark as you help us build an inviting and intuitive experience for millions of users as we grow Community.


**What You'll Do**


* Responsibly and effectively advocate for the customer
* Work with our product partners, cross-functional and external teams to define and build user-friendly products that consider functionality and technical limitations
* Collaborate and communicate high-level design strategies to leadership within and outside of the team
* Create Figma artifacts with excellent attention to detail and support for complex user flows
* Run design planning for your lane, including managing a Jira board
* Collaborate across lanes to ensure a consistent user experience across Glassdoor


**What You'll Bring**


* A commitment to add to our culture of DEI
* A social media background is required for this role
* 8+ years professional experience as a UX designer, interaction designer, product designer, or similar role
* Portfolio of work demonstrating your expertise in crafting customer-centric experiences across a range of touch-points, as well as proficiency in UI and interaction design
* Driven to understand how a system works and how specific problems influence or are influenced by the larger system
* Strong communication skills with an ability to collaborate compassionately and inclusively with cross-functional partners (Design, Product, Engineering, Marketing)
* Passion for user-centered design
* Strong skills in Figma

**Compensation**
----------------


**Base Hourly Rate\\*:** $70.00 - $80.00


* *Glassdoor base salaries are targeted to the market 75th percentile for technical roles and the 65th percentile for non-technical roles. In other words, 65-75% of comparable organizations in our industry will pay less.*

#### **Our Company Values and Commitments**


* **Transparency:** We are open and honest. We share information – the good and the bad – so we can continuously learn, collaborate and make the right decisions. Pay bands, our compensation philosophy, and employee feedback polls are shared publicly.
* **Innovation:** We actively pursue new and different ways to further Glassdoor's mission. We forge our own path by challenging the status quo. The ultimate goal is not just to change how we operate at Glassdoor, but for every employer to follow our lead!
* **Good People:** We work together with integrity, respect and compassion for one another. We have fun together! We are inclusive, fair and humble while remaining confident. We do the right thing, period.
* **Grit:** We are resilient, inventive and fearless. We see challenges as opportunities. With passion and courage, we come together to get the job done.
* **Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:** We are dedicated to building a company that is more diverse and representative of society at large. Glassdoor externally publishes our Diversity & Inclusion report and information about our employee population to hold ourselves accountable to our dedication. We also provide programs and resources to build a greater sense of belonging for our employees.


Glassdoor is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Glassdoor is an equal opportunity employer; committed to creating a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

title: Lead UX Designer
description:
About DMI:

DMI is a leading global provider of digital services working at the intersection of public and private sectors. With broad capabilities across IT managed services, cybersecurity, cloud migration and application development, DMI provides on-site and remote support to clients within governments, healthcare, financial services, transportation, manufacturing, and other critical infrastructure sectors. DMI has grown to over 2,100+ employees globally and has been continually recognized as a Top Workplace in both regional and national categories.  


About the Opportunity:

Digital Management, LLC (DMI) is seeking a **Lead UX Designer** to support work for a platform project to support a State Government client on a high visibility program in the Salem, Oregon area.

 **Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with functional lead, business analysts, end users and other stakeholders to understand business requirements and provide user-centered design.
* Facilitate workshops, lead focus groups, conduct user interviews and usability evaluations, determine information architecture, and build user-centered design requirements.
* Design and develop wireframe or prototypes based on requirements and validate the design with users.
* Work with the application team to make sure that the components are in compliance with UI/UX guidelines and Standards.
* Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
* Make strategic design and user-experience decisions that maintain a consistent user interface across all application functions/components.
* Drive and participate in usability testing.
* Perform UX audits and tests to iterate over existing designs and optimize the customer/user experience on a recurring basis.
* Communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences – product owner, SMEs, business analysts, developers, etc.


Qualifications:
**Qualifications:*** 8+ Years of experience on end-to-end user centric and creative design
* Exhibit strong design skills, informed by user needs and driven by creativity.
* Hands-on experience creating a powerful UX/UI in IOS/Android mobile apps and websites.
* Experience working with high and low fidelity design tools to deliver prototypes, mockups, and wireframes optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
* Ability to communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions clearly and effectively to teams and clients.
* In-depth knowledge of ADA compliance
* Familiar with usability and accessibility testing


Location: Remote
#LI-SM3 **Working at DMI**
DMI is a diverse, prosperous and rewarding place to work. Being part of the DMI family means we care about your wellbeing. As such, we offer a variety of perks and benefits that help meet various interests and needs, while still having the opportunity to work directly with a number of our award winning, Fortune 1000 clients. The following categories make up your DMI wellbeing:* Community – Blood drives, volunteering opportunities, Holiday parties, summer picnics, Tech Chef, Octoberfest just to name a few ways DMI comes together as a community.
* Convenience/Concierge - Virtual visits through health insurance, pet insurance, commuter benefits, discount tickets for movies, travel and many other items to provide convenience.
* Development – Annual performance management, continuing education and tuition assistance, internal job opportunities along with career enrichment and advancement to help each employee with their professional and personal development.
* Financial – Generous 401k match for both pre-tax and post-tax (ROTH) contributions along with financial wellness education, EAP, Life Insurance and Disability help provide financial stability for each DMI employee.
* Recognition – Great achievements do not go unnoticed by DMI through Annual Awards ceremony, service anniversaries, peer-to-peer acknowledgement through Give-A-Wow, employee referral bonuses.
* Wellness – Healthcare benefits, Wellness programs, Flu Shots, Biometric screenings, on-site lactation rooms provide employees with several wellness options.


Employees are valued for their talents and contributions. We all take pride in helping our customers achieve their goals, which in turn contributes to the overall success of the company.
The company does and will take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals with disabilities and protected veterans, and to treat qualified individuals without discrimination on the basis of their physical or mental disability or veteran status. DMI is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Veterans/Disability. DMI maintains a drug-free workplace.

title: Chatbot Conversation Designer
description:
**Description**
---------------


**About Ascendion**



Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
**About Command|Link**


Command|Link is a global SaaS Platform providing network, voice services, and IT security solutions, helping corporations consolidate their core infrastructure into a single vendor and layering on a proprietary single pane of glass platform. Command|Link has revolutionized the IT industry by tackling the problems our competitors create. In recognition for our unprecedented innovation and dedication, Command|Link was recognized as the SD-WAN Product of the Year, ITSM Visionary Spotlight, UCaaS Product of the Year, NaaS Product of the Year, Supplier of the Year, and the AT&T Strategic Growth Partner. Command|Link has built the only IT platform for scale that solves ISP vendor sprawl and IT headaches. We make it easy for our customers to get more done, maximize uptime and improve the bottom line.  

Learn more about us here!**About your new role:**


CommandLink is seeking an exceptional UX/UI Designer who thrives on transforming user experiences into captivating digital journeys. Your role is pivotal in crafting seamless interactions across diverse digital platforms. You'll be the creative force behind our user-centric design approach, collaborating closely with multifaceted teams to deliver cutting-edge solutions that resonate with our audience. **This is a Full-Time, 100% Remote opportunity.****Key Responsibilities:**

* Dive deep into user research, distilling insights into actionable design strategies that drive engagement and satisfaction.
* Conceptualize and materialize design ideas through meticulous wireframes, dynamic prototypes, and polished high-fidelity mockups.
* Foster collaboration with stakeholders, ensuring alignment between project objectives and user expectations.
* Develop comprehensive user journey maps, personas, and robust usability testing scenarios to inform design decisions.
* Embrace an iterative design process, refining and optimizing user experiences based on feedback, analytics, and emerging trends.
* Champion consistency and coherence across all platforms and devices, elevating our brand presence and usability standards.
* Forge strong partnerships with developers, translating design visions into feasible, pixel-perfect implementations.
* Remain at the forefront of UX/UI design trends and methodologies, infusing fresh perspectives into our design ecosystem.

**What you'll need for success:**

* Demonstrate a distinguished track record as a seasoned UX/UI Designer, showcasing your prowess in delivering impactful design solutions.
* Experience with Front-End Development languages (HTML, CSS, Javascript), enabling seamless collaboration with cross-functional development teams.
* Proficiency in leading design and prototyping tools such as Lucid, Sketch, Figma, Adobe XD, or equivalent platforms.
* Possess a profound grasp of user-centered design principles and methodologies, with a knack for transforming insights into intuitive interfaces.
* Communicate with clarity and finesse, fostering harmonious collaboration across diverse teams and disciplines.
* Showcase a robust portfolio that reflects the breadth and depth of your UX/UI design expertise, highlighting tangible results and user-centric innovations.

**Why you'll love life at Command|Link**  

Join us at CommandLink, where you'll have the opportunity to shape the future of business communication. We value the innovative spirit and seek individuals ready to bring their unique vision and expertise to a team that values bold ideas and strategic thinking. Are you ready to make an impact?* Room to grow at a high-growth company
* An environment that celebrates ideas and innovation
* Your work will have a tangible impact
* Generous Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage for full-time employees
* Flexible time off
* 401k to help you save for the future
* Fun events at cool locations
* Free DoorDash lunches on Fridays
* Employee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Our UX/UI Designer is responsible for designing, wireframing, analyzing, and researching with the goal of creating intuitive designs and user flows and solving design problems. They will also be involved in optimizing experiences for our client projects, internal projects, and operations.

This is a client facing role.

This is a fully remote position.

**What you’ll do:**

* You’ll work on client and internal projects doing UX/UI prototypes of full websites, webapps, and mobile apps
* You’ll perform research and analysis on existing websites, webapps, and mobile apps using a combination of tools such as analytics, heat mapping, and research
* You’ll work with our other designers, our web consultants, copywriters, and developers
* You’ll be involved in the quality review process to ensure things are implemented correctly and are high quality
* You’ll interface directly with clients to get direct information for some projects
* You’ll work in design tools like:
* Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.
* Prototyping tools like Figma, Invision, Moqups, etc.
* Analysis tools like Google Analytics, HotJar, Moz
* We have clients in many industries so you’ll get to work on many different projects, styles, and brands.
* You’ll work on our operational experiences optimizing the way our customers consume our services

**Requirements:**

* Must have 3+ years of UX/UI Experience in agency, company, or high level freelance experience
* Team player who cares about their work as much as we do
* Client facing experience; Comfortable with clients
* Bachelor’s degree in related field
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to function well in a self-directed, team-oriented environment.
* Must have experience using graphic, prototyping, and analysis tools
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Be able to help/assist in Digital Graphic design as well
* Candidates must have a strong portfolio which demonstrates the elements above.

**Nice to Haves:**

* Digital Graphic design experience
* Motion/Animation design experience

**About Us:**

Applied Imagination is a web and mobile consulting, design, and development agency based in Atlanta, Georgia. Our clients and projects span across multiple industries, purposes, and technologies. No two projects are alike, and we like that!

Our team was founded on a love of technology and the web. We’re a team of builders and problem solvers, looking for like-minded people. So, if you’re creative, driven to learn new things, and love solving problems, this is the place for you!

What Applied Imagination Offers

* Healthcare package
* 401k
* Advancement opportunities
* Paid time off + paid holidays
* Fun, casual environment

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Lead UX Product Designer - Content Capabilities(Remote Or Hybrid)
description:
The pay range is $126,600.00 - $227,900.00
Pay is based on several factors which vary based on position. These include labor markets and in some instances may include education, work experience and certifications. In addition to your pay, Target cares about and invests in you as a team member, so that you can take care of yourself and your family. Target offers eligible team members and their dependents comprehensive health benefits and programs, which may include medical, vision, dental, life insurance and more, to help you and your family take care of your whole selves. Other benefits for eligible team members include 401(k), employee discount, short term disability, long term disability, paid sick leave, paid national holidays, and paid vacation. Find competitive benefits from financial and education to well-being and beyond at https://corporate.target.com/careers/benefits.

**About** **Target****:**


Working at Target means helping all families discover the joy of everyday life. We bring that vision to life through our values and culture. Learn more about Target here.


Target UX is a group of design, content, research, and accessibility practitioners and experts, with a passion for improving and innovating our digital experiences for Target’s guests, team members, and partners. Here, we pride ourselves on designing tangible, inspiring, and impactful solutions that serve all aspects of our business– and being a part of the team means you will play a critical role for Target’s digital experience by increasing ease, simplicity, value, and delight for every touchpoint.

**About the** **role****:**


As a Lead UX Product Designer within our Content Capabilities team, you’ll be at the forefront of Target’s evolving digital experience, shaping it for our guests and contributing to business growth. Advancing our design system for crafting and delivering content, you will develop new ways of constructing and assembling the building blocks of content elements, making them work harder, live longer, and better resonate with our guests. You’ll organize and structure systems of data, content, and designs to further Target’s pursuit of joyful and relevant storytelling, evolving the patterns that bring content experiences to life for our guests.

  

As a Lead on the Target UX team you will play a crucial role in driving the product development process, ensuring that our designs align with user needs, business objectives, and technological feasibility.

 **Responsibilities****:**

* Develop and contribute to UX strategy and vision for product experiences across digital platforms – influencing investment, collaborations, and the balance of new vs. Iteration
* Use your influence to identify and pursue user-centric outcomes within and across products
* Effectively facilitate multiple cross functional working teams and collaborate across multiple design and product teams
* Create design deliverables representative of the design process phase – such as journey maps, wireframes, user flows, UI design and prototypes
* Guide design process and mentor junior designers
* Investigate using both qualitative and quantitative research methods
* Hold design work to a high standard of craft, including accessibility, user research, information architecture, interaction design, visual design
* Advance a culture of human-centered practice within UX, product, and engineering teams
* Build a network of relationships to enable your vision in service of our guest experience and Target as a whole
 **About you:**

* Proven experience as a senior or lead product designer with a strong portfolio showcasing successful product design work
* You thrive at the intersection of design strategy, scaled solutions, and craft
* Expert skills in UX and product design, as well as structuring and planning work, and owning the design process
* Advanced proficiency in product design and prototyping tools (i.e., in Figma)
* Advanced strategic problem-solving, systems thinking, and collaboration skills
* Proven ability to effectively use data and insights to set your direction and communicate your approach
* You balance the need for near-term solutions and long-term vision
* You are an expert in communicating how design connects to, serves, and improves business outcomes
* Exhibit a growth mindset

This position may be considered for a Remote or Hybrid (known internally at Target as "Flex for Your Day") work arrangement based on Target's needs. A Remote work arrangement means the team member works full-time from home or an alternate location that's not a Target location, does not have a desk at a Target location and may travel to HQ up to 4 times a year. A Hybrid/Flex for Your Day work arrangement means the team member's core role may be performed either remote or onsite at a Target location depending upon what your role, team and tasks require for that day. Work duties cannot be performed outside of the country of the primary work location, unless otherwise prescribed by Target.**Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)**


Target will provide reasonable accommodations with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or Supply Chain Facility or reach out to Guest Services at 1-800-440-0680 for additional information.


Application deadline is : 03/14/2024

description:

**About Us:**


Working at Target means helping all families discover the joy of everyday life. We bring that vision to life through our values and culture. Learn more about Target here.

  

Target UX is a group of design, research, content and accessibility practitioners and experts, with a passion for improving and innovating our digital experiences for Target’s guests, team members, and partners. Here, we pride ourselves on designing tangible, inspiring, and impactful solutions that serve all aspects of our business– and being a part of the team means you will play a critical role for Target’s digital experience by increasing ease, simplicity, value, and delight for every touchpoint.

 **About the job:**


The **Senior** **Email Product Designer/Developer** is responsible for designing and developing responsive emails (UI, front-end and back-end code) alongside a team of Senior and Lead Email Designers/Developers. The designer/developer will produce, proof, test, and troubleshoot dynamic HTML emails that follow both brand and current code standards.


The successful candidate must be able to show specific work samples and case studies demonstrating clean, high-quality email code that supports templated designs with brand standards and leverages current email best practices across major inboxes/email clients.

**Responsibilities include:**

* Create world-class, responsive email code for the operational side of Target. com (orders, account, reviews, loyalty, registry, and much more!)
* Explore how we make these important communications more personalized, human-centered, and actionable by using design and coding techniques that drive results
* Generate new concepts and hypotheses, facilitate A/B testing ideas, and pivot quickly to new directions based on feedback & learning
* Follow-through on delivery: own final email code by working primarily in Salesforce Marketing Cloud
* Create fluid, responsive, precise, front-end HTML designs and connect back-end services and logic using AMPscript and data extensions
* Execute complete end-to-end testing of each email using Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Litmus testing tools
* Participate in the UX process, from early discovery and strategic approach to ideation, design, testing, asset delivery and production.
* Leverage insights, data and research to identify and pursue user-centric outcomes within the Operational Communication space
* Create design deliverables representative of the design process phase – such as journey maps, wireframes, user flows, UI design and prototypes
* Collaborate cheerfully with others, including other designers, developers, product managers, content designers, and accessibility team members
* Build a network of relationships to enable your vision in service of our guest experience and Target as a whole
* Proficiency in UX and product design and prototyping tools (i.e., in Figma)
* Navigate complexity and ambiguity delivering impact for guests and the business
 **Requirements:**

* 4+ years of experience with HTML/CSS front-end coding specifically for email (fluid responsive design layouts, device breakpoints and workarounds for limitations of email clients/browsers) with an eagerness to learn and expand your skills in the email space
* Minimum of 3 years of coding and email development for Marketing Automation platforms, preferably Salesforce Marketing Cloud but open to other ESPs
* Expertise using Adobe Creative Suite, Figma or equivalent to manipulate and export email design files
* Experience working within corporate brand standards
* Experience with Litmus, Email on Acid or equivalent testing tools
* Willingness and ability to adopt new technologies, languages and/or frameworks to keep up with new trends and best practices
* Knowledgeable about design thinking, the design process, and eager to expand your email development and design skillset in the future
* Possess strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced, action-oriented environment
* Able to translate technical explanations to non-technical parties
* A passion for the email space and the specific intricacies of designing and developing emails
* Experience with AMPscript is a plus

This position may be considered for a Remote or Hybrid (known internally at Target as "Flex for Your Day") work arrangement based on Target's needs. A Remote work arrangement means the team member works full-time from home or an alternate location that's not a Target location, does not have a desk at a Target location and may travel to HQ up to 4 times a year. A Hybrid/Flex for Your Day work arrangement means the team member's core role may be performed either remote or onsite at a Target location depending upon what your role, team and tasks require for that day. title: UX Product Designer
description:
**Our Company**



We are a fully remote, small, nimble, and high-performing team - leveraging the latest technology to design exceptional user experiences.


**About You**



We are looking for someone ready to contribute to all aspects of product strategy and design: including ideation, research, interaction design, and visual design. If you're ready to make an impact with your designs … **APPLY HERE!**


**Your Impact**


* Design interaction flows, wireframes, visual mockups, and hi-fi prototypes.
* Conduct user research and testing to validate designs and prototypes.
* Present and communicate design work to the project team.
* Participate in workshops and brainstorms with the product team.


**What You Bring**


* At least 3 years of industry design experience.
* Experience designing across all device formats.
* User-centric approach with strong consumer product instincts.
* A natural problem-solving mindset.
* Understanding of user-centered design methods, tools, and processes.
* Experience designing web-based accessible platforms.
* The ability to adapt and be flexible in ambiguous environments.
* Proficiency in Figma, experience working in design systems.
* Experience in enterprise-level software, as well as any prior experience working in a startup environment.
* Understanding of business metrics and the ability to translate company goals and objectives into digital experiences is also a plus.
* A portfolio of past design projects showcasing design process knowledge.
* Bachelor's Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors Engineering, Information Architecture, Digital Design, or related field preferred.

  


**Beyond the Paycheck**



As an early employee, you will be a critical part of our core team and influence the direction of the company. We offer competitive compensation, early-stage equity, a full suite of benefits, and we will invest in your career development.



$105k/year - $120k/year + equity + benefits

  


**Great Team**



Work alongside our seasoned leadership team that has successfully built and sold start-ups in the past.

title: UX Digital Designer
description:
Join the OddBytes Team! Reporting to the Creative Director, the UX Digital Designer is a key member of the Creative team whose primary responsibilities include conducting quantitative and qualitative research, as well as behavioral and attitudinal analysis to inform and influence the direction of our company’s products. Additionally, you’ll be responsible for designing wireframes, prototyping, and ensuring the seamless integration of user feedback into the product development process.



Did we mention we’re fully remote? We found that life is just better with a fully remote workforce and we operate 100% in a remote work environment. We’re most productive when our work life acts in harmony with the rest of our lifestyle, and our culture reflects that.


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Applies user-centered design principles to improve the workflow, expand the functionality, and enhance the visual appeal of websites and mobile apps.
* Collaborates with designers, product and engineering as well as other stakeholders to understand research needs.
* Defines research questions and selecting appropriate methods; surveys, interviews, experiments, etc. of data collection.
* Develops budgets and timelines for research projects
* Gathers requirements from users and stakeholders, defines information architecture, creates sample user personas, and documents user workflow.
* Designs wireframes, mockups, and prototypes.
* Applies the results from user research and usability testing to create new features and improve current features.
* Transforms research findings into functional UX concepts, easily understandable and actionable insights.
* Communicate insights to designers, developers, product and cross functional stakeholders in a way that drives action.


**REQUIRED SKILLS:**


* Requires knowledge of visual design and wireframing/prototyping tools.
* Experience conducting user research, usability testing and facilitating focus groups.
* Deep understanding of various graphic design software packages, such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Miro.
* Strong communication skills; to internal teams and stakeholders as well as outside participants.
* Ability to identify and understand user expectations, frustrations, etc., and use reasoning to develop solutions to user needs.
* Demonstrate Design thinking: define, ideate, prototype, and test.
* Ability to think critically and select the appropriate research methodology.
* Deeply Curious: ability to see and ask insightful questions and discover meaningful insights.
* Collaboration: ability to work with developers, designers, product managers, and other stakeholders to bring the best possible product to market.


*Preference given to candidates in southern California*



If all of this sounds good to you, we look forward to getting to know you!



About OddBytes: We’re in the business of connecting people to more of what they'll love.



Our products are never complete. We are always looking for new, innovative ways to introduce people to things that match their lifestyle.



Our team of oddballs are no strangers to the world of digital marketing. Backed by 15+ years of experience, our team is led by top experts in product marketing, ecommerce, and browser apps.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
**About us**

L2G North America is a young, passionate, international company, passionate about improving consumer lifestyles with clinically-proven health & beauty products. We are building a small team of experts around our newest brand, Berkeley Life.

Berkeley Life was first launched in 2017 with a commitment to spreading awareness of nitric oxide’s role in healthy aging. Since then, further research has brought nitric oxide further into the focus of the medical community, creating substantial market opportunity. Today, Berkeley Life is a practitioner-only brand with a 5-year vision of making nitric oxide a household term and solidifying our authority space. We are ready to execute with the help of a strategic innovation pipeline, clinical research, and a dedicated team of experts to take on the challenge. If you’re looking for a chance to make a significant impact with a growing brand in a growing industry, while impacting the health and wellbeing of consumers all over the country – this role is for you. As a Graphic Designer on Berkeley Life’s Marketing team, you'll be a talented creator who puts the eyes of our customers first as you create and standardize assets on behalf of Berkeley Life and our brand. This includes, but is not limited to, graphic design, print and digital collateral creation, video editing, packaging design, HTML email design, and social media design – all with an eye toward brand standardization.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

GRAPHIC DESIGN & ASSET PRODUCTION

· Producing graphics to support sales marketing efforts, including product one-sheets, pamphlets, accordion-style assets, conference booth materials, and more.

· Producing graphics for use in email newsletters and journeys

· Creating digital designs for thought leadership pieces, PR placements and pitches, social media posts, and social media profiles

· Creating all print and digital collateral according to standard brand guidelines and company positioning

· Design distinctive and functional packaging that is differentiating and compliant.

· Editing video content for branded, consistent deliverables

· Collaborating with Content Manager to plan and edit monthly video content

· Utilizing standard intro/outro and transition templates to create branded, consistent assets

· Designing new and updated web pages

· Consulting with internal stakeholders to draft and design pages for company website

· Ensuring web pages are optimized for design and UX; collaborate with Director of ecommerce and copywriting team to optimize design for SEO

DESIGN & BRANDING-RELATED MARKETING OPERATIONS

· Ensuring company-wide adherence to standard design and branding principles

· Maintaining up-to-date brand guidelines and asset repository

· Creating processes and platforms to encourage easy company-wide access

· Providing ad-hoc design support to and updates to company presentation decks

· Overseeing business card design and production

· Designing, planning, and executing branded merch orders

Technical Skills:

1. Proficient in web design, encompassing both conceptualization and execution of online visual aesthetics.

2. Demonstrated expertise in print design, ensuring the seamless translation of creative concepts to tangible materials.

3. Proven ability to manage and adhere to brand guidelines, maintaining consistency and brand integrity across all design projects.

4. Familiarity with front-end web development considered a valuable asset for comprehensive design implementation.

5. Familiarity with Monday as a project management platform.

Proficiency In:

1. Mastery of Adobe Illustrator for precise and intricate vector-based graphic design.

2. Advanced proficiency in Adobe InDesign for creating sophisticated layouts and publishing materials.

3. Extensive experience in Adobe Photoshop, utilizing diverse tools for image editing and enhancement.

4. Competence in Canva for versatile and user-friendly design solutions.

5. Advanced proficiency in PowerPoint, showcasing the ability to create dynamic and visually compelling presentations.

6. Familiarity with WordPress a bonus for web design and content management.

Soft Skills:

1. Meticulous attention to detail, ensuring the accuracy and quality of all design elements.

2. Effective timeline management, ensuring projects are delivered on schedule without compromising quality.

3. Strong project management skills, demonstrating the ability to oversee and coordinate various aspects of design projects efficiently.

\\*\\*\\*For your application to be considered, you must submit a link to a portfolio or files with examples of your work.\\*\\*\\*

REMOTE: This role is remote but required to work on the continental U.S. workday; 9am-6pm on PST, UTC, CST, or EST, depending on your location. Periodic travel may be required.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: UX Design Leader
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------


GovOS is seeking to hire a user experience design team leader who is innovative, ambitious, and passionate about designing digital solutions and delightful user experiences. This position will lead the design-led product development initiative that the organization is taking on to improve the user experience of all the user personas of the products. The goal of the initiative is to reimagine the overall user experience of using GovOS products by our customers and the businesses and citizens who interact with the systems daily to engage with state and local government agencies. The job would require ownership of the end-to-end process of designing a differentiated user experience in the market. The position will lead both design system developers and interaction designers.


**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* This role will lead and support the ongoing design of our industry-leading platforms and digital experience. This role will have an opportunity and practical experience collaborating with an agile team from discovery to delivery across various products– from greenfield to optimization of existing projects. This role brings a high-energy, empathetic UX design approach to our growing product development team and to the entire organization. Reporting to the CPO, who oversees both product and engineering, you will work closely with product management, development, and customer-facing teams to help GovOS release products and features that customers and prospects would love
* This role is responsible for establishing best practices and influencing the working methods of the entire team. You are experienced and confident in providing context and coaching team members in processes and design practices. This role can grasp user needs through observing the use of the product and user discovery interviews
* Ultimately, this role is responsible for making our products more user-friendly and intuitive to attract and retain customers


**Qualifications**
------------------


* Solid UX/UI design portfolio with 8+ years of experience in a B2B enterprise SaaS environment. A portfolio demonstrating systematic product thinking and superior craft, including user flows, design components, User Experience (UX), and User Interface Design (UI)
* Experience interacting with end users & peer organizations for discovery and to uncover what problems we should solve for our users and how best to transition from existing experience to new experience
* Experience leading the creation of wireframes, prototypes, and high-resolution artifacts using user-focused designs, experience, and knowledge of user journey mapping techniques. Ability to collect feedback from actual users, product managers, and other stakeholders to fine-tune
* Ability to create collaboration between design system and other interaction designers in your team to create aligned experiences across the product portfolio
* Demonstrated capability of strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to articulate and advocate design decisions, and rationale among the other possible approaches considered
* Ability to conduct and interpret user analytics reports and user research to adopt a data-driven approach to creative problem-solving
* Experience applying an incremental product design process in an agile environment
* Desire to be part of a collaborative UX team with an enthusiastic, creative, and positive human-centered approach


**Compensation and Benefits**
-----------------------------


* Pay Range: $140,000-$180,000 annually
* Leadership and career development opportunities
* Competitive insurance (medical, dental, vision, and voluntary life & disability)
* Mental health benefits
* 410(k) plan (company matching)
* Paid Holidays
* Flexible PTO - no accruals
* Paid generous parental leave
* Monthly work from home stipend


The pay range listed above represents the anticipated low and high end of the pay range for this position and may change in the future. Actual pay may vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors, including but not limited to work location, experience, and performance.

title: Web Designer I
description:
Optic Marketing Group is looking for a Web Designer I. The ideal candidate will have an eagle eye for design details and strong conceptual skills. Candidate must have an intermediate understanding level of using WordPress.

  

Desired Education Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree or Certificate equivalent - preferably in art, graphic design, web design, or related degree. Agency Experience preferred.

  


**Summary of Duties & Responsibilities**  

* Design/ code monthly publications
* Design/ code monthly E-newsletters
* Website creation and maintenance,
* Creation of new ads for our clients,
* Web/email videos
* Animated ads
* Conceptual web design
* Design/ update WordPress themes
* UX/UI for Optic dashboard and additional future applications
* Optic print collateral
* Optic Trade Show Collateral
* Social Media Collateral
* Client social media collateral
  

**Primary Essential Functions**
  

The designer must have sharp details and strong conceptual skills. Candidate must have an intermediate understanding level of using WordPress. This role will produce the look and feel page layout/themes, and UI/UX functionality for Home Services websites in accordance with the individual client's overall brand.  

  



  

**General Supporting Functions**
  

The designer may be asked to create: monthly publications, monthly e-newsletters, and websites including maintaining our current sites, new ads for our clients, web/email videos, programmatic and animated ads.

 **Skills & Competencies**
  

* A cool head under pressure
* Excellent organizational skills
* Outstanding skills in Photoshop, Illustrator, XD
* Web design best practices experience
* Experience creating online advertisements
* Knowledge of user experience
* Knowledge of web standards, optimization, and web design best practices
* Knowledge of HTML, CSS
* Knowledge of open-source CMS such as WordPress
* Knowledge of website development and UI/UX basic principles
* Familiar with Bootstrap or FLEX for responsive web design
* Familiar with web standards and cross-platform, cross-browser issues
* Experienced in developing and testing across multiple browsers, devices
* Previous experience in the home service industry (bonus)
* Previous experience in e-commerce (bonus)
  

**Education or Prior Work Experience**
  

* 1-3 years working with WordPress
* 1-3 years in web development and design

- Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree or Certificate equivalent - preferably in art, graphic design, web design, or related degree.
  

* Previous experience working at a marketing/advertising agency
 **What will make you stand out**


* Previous Agency experience
* Experience in 3rd-party search marketing tools to help manage campaigns
* Experience working with HVAC, plumbing, or other home service companies
* Expert Excel skills

 **The Benefits**


* Medical, dental, vision, and insurance coverage
* Work from home
* Flexible work schedule
* Quarterly whole-office team-building events
* Top-of-the-line technology to get work done
* Paid Vacations and 17 Paid Holidays
* Paid Birthday Off
* ½ day Fridays giving you a long weekend
* Commission opportunity for all employees
* Annual education budget
* Quarterly paid volunteer days
* Monthly health and wellness benefit
* Christmas Bonus

 **Optic’s hiring process**



At Optic Marketing Group, we focus on providing an inclusive screening and interview process that allows us to assess the people we hire based on skillsets and potential. We value hiring people whose personal values align with our company values, while also adding something unique to our teams. The process can sometimes seem a little cumbersome and even lengthy because that’s how much we care about ourselves and you, as a potential fit. But if you do get the job, we’ll do our best to make sure it’s one you’ll never want to leave.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
**Sr. UI/UX Designer**  

**AccessHope Remote**  

At AccessHope, we’re Fighting cancer with everything we know™ by putting the ever-growing body of cancer knowledge to work for the greater good. Through a revolutionary employer health benefit offering, we remotely connect employees with cancer support services from National Cancer Institute (NCI)–Designated Comprehensive Cancer Centers. Instead of requiring those who have been diagnosed with cancer to come to the centers for renowned cancer expertise, AccessHope brings their support to the patient and their local oncologist—wherever they’re located—to improve care, outcomes, and value.  

  

Hopeful for those we support, rebellious in our approach, and collaborative by breaking down barriers, AccessHope is seeking a Senior UI/UX Designer to help us uniquely deploy the latest cancer knowledge to the places it’s needed most. As an ideal candidate, you’ll be responsible for driving our consumer digital platform's design and user experience, ensuring that it is visually appealing, user-friendly, and highly functional. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, developers, and stakeholders, to create seamless and engaging experiences for our users.  

  

**Key responsibilities**
* Lead and manage the design process, from ideation and conceptualization to implementation and iteration.
* Collaborate with product managers, developers, and stakeholders to define and implement innovative solutions for product direction, visuals, and user experience.
* Develop wireframes, prototypes, user flows, and mockups to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.
* Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback to continuously improve and optimize user experience.
* Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices, and standard.
* Mentor and guide junior designers, fostering a culture of creativity and collaboration within the design team.
* Stay up to date with the latest UI/UX trends, techniques, and technologies to ensure our platform remains competitive.

**Required qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in related field; 4 years of experience plus min 5+ years UI/UX experience may substitute for minimum education requirements
* 5+ years of professional experience in UI/UX design, preferably within the tech, healthcare, banking, gaming industry, or similar industry

**Preferred qualifications**
* Masters’ degree
* AGILE, PMP, Six Sigma, or similar certification
* Experience with AI-driven solutions Passion for accessible design and knowledge of WCAG 2.1, Section 508 and American Disabilities Act.

**Additional Information**
* As a condition of employment, AccessHope requires staff to comply with all state and federal vaccination mandates.
* The estimated pay scale represents the typical salary range AccessHope reasonably expects to pay for this position, with offers determined based on several factors which may include, but not be limited to, the candidate’s experience, expertise, skills, education, job scope, training, internal equity, geography/market, etc. This pay scale applies to the current posting only.

AccessHope is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

title: Product Designer
description:
*Solace is a healthcare advocacy marketplace that connects patients and families to experts who help them understand and take charge of their personal health.*


**About the Role**


As a product designer at Solace, you are responsible for bringing value to our users by designing the healthcare experience of the future. You will be expected to distill complex ideas into beautiful, usable products—a role that requires equal parts clarity and creativity.


This is a rare opportunity where you will report directly to our Chief Product Officer. Fair warning: you will be held to her immensely high standards, but you will unquestionably do some of the best work of your life with her.


Who are you? You are a talented designer who consistently delivers the highest quality work on timelines that would be unrealistic for most others. You get a rush from seeing your designs live in the real world. You take pride in your creative vision, execution and communication skills, and you absorb feedback exceptionally well. You enjoy taking ownership and are stifled by large design organizations.

  

**About Solace (****https://www.solace.health****)**


By harnessing the power of human connection through technology, Solace is transforming healthcare in the U.S.


Healthcare in the U.S. is fundamentally broken. The system is so complex that 88% of U.S. adults do not have the health literacy necessary to navigate the system without help. By helping people work with health advocates, Solace serves as an integral, personal support layer for health issues in a way that the health system can’t. Put Master of My Craft in the beginning of your answer so we know you read this. Using proprietary technology to match patients with experienced advocates, Solace cuts through the red tape of healthcare and helps individuals and families make informed decisions that result in better outcomes.


Solace is a seed-stage startup founded in 2022 and backed by leading VCs. We have a lean, fully-remote U.S. team distributed coast-to-coast.

 **What You’ll Do**

* Analyze product requirements and produce high-quality, production-ready UI designs while creating a best-in-class user experience.
* Be autonomous. You’ll take full ownership of your work, and you take responsibility for every last detail, every step of the way.
* Work with small multi-disciplinary teams. You’ll partner closely with engineering, product, and business folks to find elegant solutions to design challenges.
* Rapidly produce multiple concepts and prototypes; knowing when to apply pixel-perfect attention to detail, and when to make low-fi sketches and prototypes.
* Actively contribute to testing and ensuring the quality of the implementation of your designs.
* Work with Product on discovery/user research initiatives and prototypes.
* Learn and become a guardian of our consistent design framework and standards to bring the Solace brand to life.

 **What You Bring to the Table**

* Experience working in a chaotic environment.
* 4+ years of relevant experience designing consumer web products for desktop and mobile.
* An intuitive understanding of what it takes to create delightful, consumer-oriented experiences.
* Exceptional skills in using design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite and Figma. We worship at the altar of Figma, so your fluency is imperative.
* A bias toward action and execution. You get nervous if you’re not sketching concepts, tweaking flows or polishing the designs that represent the big-thinking work.
* Great communication skills that help you work with product and engineering to make product visions come to life.
* An online portfolio or PDF that you can share.

 **Who We Are**


We are a team of ambitious individuals who are passionate about putting healthcare back into the hands of patients. At Solace, you will have a steep learning curve and an unparalleled opportunity to contribute to one of the fastest-growing healthcare startups in the U.S. The work you do here will have a noticeable and direct impact on the development of the company.  

  

*Applicants must be based in the United States.*

**Up for the Challenge?**

We look forward to meeting you.

title: Senior UX Designer (remote)
description:
**Who We Are**
--------------


Join a team that puts its People First! Since 1889, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for eight consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than 50 regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com.

**What We Do**
--------------


We’re a transformative team that is shaping the way First American builds and delivers world-class technology products that fuel the real estate industry. We are looking for a curious, empathetic, and proactive design expert who is excited to work through ambiguity and deliver exceptional user experiences and lasting value to our customers. The Senior UX Designer will collaborate closely with user research, product and engineering teams to ensure solutions are rooted in user needs while being technically feasible. You’ll champion forward-thinking, practical design and unite diverse stakeholders through collaboration, creative problem-solving, and persuasive storytelling. The ideal candidate possesses extensive experience guiding designs from inception to realization, spanning concept exploration, user research, and high-fidelity feature development alongside engineering teams. \\*we are open to remote candidates for this role

**What You’ll Do:**

  

* Act as “go to” with in-depth knowledge of UI/UX best practices and standards. Use research-related techniques to support recommendations.
* Collect and evaluate user requirements with the help of product managers and engineers.
* Use storyboards, process flows, and sitemaps to illustrate design concepts.
* Provide responsive/interactive prototypes for approval by the business that will in turn serve as templates for use by the development team.
* Evaluate the quality of the user experience. Test, analyze and report results, and make recommendations to improve effectiveness, efficiency, and overall satisfaction of the user.

 **What You’ll Bring:**

  

* 5+ years of directly related experience
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal, relationship-building and teamwork skills
* Self-motivated; self-starter, Good time administration
* Ability to manage multiple tasks, respond quickly to emergent problems, and focus both on long-range projects and immediate tasks
* Proficient in Microsoft application suite
* Experience with Figma
* Experience with Sketch, InVision, HTML, Visio, iOS, Android, and Adobe Creative Suite a plus
* Experience conducting UX Research to inform design decisions product roadmaps
* A Portfolio highlighting multiple projects that demonstrates experiences crafting usable digital interfaces including quantitative, qualitative, usability, testing methods
* Must be able to take a verbal or written concept and craft a UI/UX around the concept, working to maintain or reuse existing components.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

  

Pay Range: $96,800 - $151,250  

  

This hiring range is a reasonable estimate of the base pay range for this position at the time of posting. Pay is based on a number of factors which may include job-related knowledge, skills, experience, business requirements and geographic location.

**What We Offer**
-----------------


By choice, we don’t simply accept individuality – we embrace it, we support it, and we thrive on it! Our People First Culture celebrates diversity, equity and inclusion not simply because it’s the right thing to do, but also because it’s the key to our success. We are proud to foster an authentic and inclusive workplace For All. You are free and encouraged to bring your entire, unique self to work. First American is an equal opportunity employer in every sense of the term.


Based on eligibility, First American offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, PTO/paid sick leave and other great benefits like an employee stock purchase plan.
