title: JR Web Designer
description:
**Jr. Web Designer**

**About Ripley Entertainment Inc.**

**For over 100 years,** Ripley Entertainment Inc. has been a leader in location-based family entertainment. Built on the foundation of a daily newspaper cartoon in 1918 — still in print today — Ripley Entertainment has grown to be a world leader in family entertainment, expanding to include more than 100 attractions in 10 countries around the world. Along with Ripley’s Believe It or Not! Odditoriums, Guinness World Records Attractions, Aquariums, WaxWorks, traveling shows, and miniature golf, the world of Ripley’s continues to grow through exciting new experiences, content, and books for all ages.

  

Learn more about Ripley Entertainment by visiting Ripleys.com.

 **Job Description:**

  

We are looking for a Jr. Web Designer to join our team. This person will assist with designing, developing, and managing our online properties, including our network of websites, e-commerce sites, contest landing pages, email marketing, and business listings. The ideal candidate will have a keen eye for UX/UI design and work closely with our senior web developers, brand manager, content marketers, social media strategists, analytics manager, graphic designers, and copywriters.

  

As a Jr. Web Designer, you will work on a team with middle and senior-level colleagues, with opportunities to increase your skillset and career growth.

**Location:** Remote, United States

**Job Type:** Full-time, salary (We are not accepting contract positions)

**Responsibilities:**

* Design, develop, and assist with the management of our websites built on a headless CMS.
* Assist with creating and updating ticket types on our e-commerce sites.
* Assist in the design, development, copywriting, and deployment of external and internal email campaigns.
* Monitor and make updates to our business listings, including updating hours of operation, location descriptions, and location images.
* Create online and social media contest landing pages using our contesting platform.
* Respond to helpdesk tickets and support requests.
* Other duties as assigned.
* **A web-based portfolio must be provided for** **consideration.**

**Required skills:**


1+ years of experience of the following:

* HTML, CSS, JSON, and JavaScript
* Headless CMS like Directus, or comparable platform
* Visual Studio or comparable IDE
* Cloud hosting, such as Cloudflare or comparable platform
* Mailchimp, SendGrid, or comparable ESP platform
* Version Control System like GitHub, GitLab, or comparable system

  

Familiar or proficient in the following:

* SvelteKit UI framework
* SEO and SEM best practices
* SSL Certificates
* DNS
* Google Analytics/Google Business Manager
* Adobe Creative Suite
* Microsoft Office
* Chatmeter, or comparable reputation management platform

**Desired skills:**

* Bachelor’s degree in web design/development, or a related field
* Strong debugging and problem-solving skills
* Detail oriented, with an eye for quality.
* Ability to work with strict deadlines and tight turnaround times.
* Work in a team environment, have a flexible attitude, and ability to adapt to shifting priorities.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and collaborate with our on-site managers and other departments.
* Strong time-management
* Copywriting and copyediting skills

**Benefits:**


Ripley’s Team Members are eligible to participate in the benefits plans established by the Company, subject to the participation and eligibility requirements of those plans. Benefits offered to full time employees include:

* Medical Insurance: Choice of plans available including dental and vision coverage
* Long Term Disability and Life Insurance
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Vacation and Sick Leave

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
### **Overview:**


Two Barrels is hiring an experienced UI/UX Designer for $100,000/year. You will be a traditional company employee. This is a full time M-F position with company benefits. This is a remote position. Our main office is in Spokane WA, and we have satellite offices in Austin TX and Salt Lake City UT.



We are looking for someone who has previous experience empathizing and understanding what the end-user wants by researching and learning how the software is used and coming up with solutions that meet those needs. **This person needs to be Figma and Javascript savvy.** Someone who can excel at turning mocks into a polished functional website and help bridge the gap from UI/UX to our full-stack developers who will implement your designs. The primary responsibilities will include creating and translating UI/UX design wireframes into HTML and CSS. You may also be taking existing software pages and refreshing these with a new modern look. If you like to go the extra mile to help make software more appealing to the eye — you will fit right in. Our projects range in size from completely re-vamping an entire application, to refreshing small pieces of a bigger product.



P.S. We hate that we even have to say this, but there is a scammer out there posing to be a recruiter for this role and going as far as offering a job…please know it is not us. All communication comes from our email jobs@twobarrels.com.


### **Location:**


Remote | Spokane – Austin – SLC |
### **Duration:**


Full Time
### **Wage:**


$100,000/year
### **Responsibilities:**


* Collaborate with our full-stack teams to develop common UI components and design patterns that can be adopted and extended across product suites
* Work daily with design language and UI consistency
* Create wire frames, storyboards, user flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas
* Be the connection between our full-stack and design team by being fluent in HTML/CSS
* Develop innovative user interfaces and interactive models that leverage next generation web technologies to improve user productivity and operational efficiency
* Researching and deeply understanding problems so you can get to the root of what’s really important

### **Minimum Qualifications:**


* 3+ years experience in a UI/UX position
* Strong understanding of Figma and Javascript
* Understanding of HTML, and CSS
* Knowledge of design and development best practice
* Working knowledge of industry tools, such as Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Sketch, Zeplin, Adobe xD, Invision etc
* Excellent ability to manage timelines and be self-directed

### **Why you might like this job:**


If you’ve been searching for a place where you can come and make amazing software design and have a huge impact on people who use it, then this is your place! We don’t have preconceived notions about what software should be. It just has to be designed for the user. So, really, your imagination is the only limit on what you can do here.



Our company is known for staying on the forefront of our industry’s trends, and we set the bar others try to leap over. That means you get to play, experiment, and do whatever you need to make our software not only look good, but pack high-end functionality. If you’re tired of doing things the stuffy corporate way, come join us.



#BI-Remote


### **Benefits:**


* Great Wage & Success Meetings with your manager
* Work From Home comfort package & company provided equipment
* 22 days paid time off annually, PLUS 4 paid holidays
* 4% 401k employer matching through Fidelity
* 100% employer-paid medical, dental and vision for employees
* Maternity and Paternity Leave
* Flexible hours
* Coffee shop next door
* Crappy parking? Oh, I mean a cool downtown location for easy public transportation options…

title: Salesforce UX Designer
description:
### **About NeuraFlash:**



We are a leading AI and Consulting Partner of Amazon & Salesforce obsessed with helping our customers transform their contact centers with AI Powered Experiences. Our expertise spans across the Amazon ecosystem with Amazon Connect, Lex & Contact Lens and Salesforce ecosystem with Service Cloud Voice, Einstein Bots and Digital Channels, Service Cloud, Field Service, CPQ, MuleSoft, and Einstein Analytics. We are experts in building experiences grounded in data that transform and optimize the employee and customer journey.


### **What sets NeuraFlash apart?**



At NeuraFlash, our people form the core of our business and the soul of our brand. We hire individuals who inspire us and look at challenges as opportunities to create innovative solutions. You'll be provided with ongoing education and development opportunities via our Salesforce Partnership Program and mentorship programs created for our aspiring leaders. NeuraFlash is on the forefront of cutting-edge technologies and we understand by investing in you, we're investing in ourselves!


NeuraFlash is expanding its design team! As a User Experience (UX) Designer you will be responsible for building compelling interactive experiences for users and deliver impactful business value to our clients. You'll have the opportunity to make significant contributions to our success by working with the rest of our talented AI team to delight customers. This position is focused on overall user experience, including conversational, interaction, and visual design.


### **You'll have the opportunity to:**


* Design website functionality that ties into Salesforce and Amazon platforms
* Lead requirement gathering and client design sessions
* Help business and technology stakeholders see end-to-end experiences for customers and internal end users
* Generate sitemaps and wireframes to map out experiences
* Distill user journeys and personas into easy to understand media
* Create visual mockups for web pages, bot UIs, and agent console layouts
* Establish the content, strategies, and persona for automated solutions
* Learn to build and configure Salesforce solutions (Experience Cloud, bots, etc.)
* Work with developers and QA testers throughout the project lifecycle
* Help drive success criteria and reporting
* Show the impact of design decisions and tie business value back to success criteria
* Contribute to and maintain design systems across platforms

### **Required Qualifications:**


* User experience and user interaction work experience
* Experience doing design consulting with external stakeholders
* Ability to build and maintain a design system
* Comfortable using tools like Figma, Sketch, InVision, Visio, and Lucidchart
* Willing and able learner of new technologies (e.g., Salesforce, Amazon)
* Degree in design, user experience, human computer interaction, communication, or a related discipline

### **Preferred Skills:**


* Experience using detailed mockups and prototypes to aid in visual problem solving and client communication
* Experience designing conversational flows for text based bots (e.g., web, in-app, Facebook Messenger, etc.)
* Knowledge of user experience research methods or usability testing techniques
* Knowledge of Salesforce Experience Cloud and Service Cloud

### **What can you expect in the interview process?**


Recruiter Screen (Phone) - 30 minutes  

* 
* Manager Interview (Video) - 45 minutes
* + You'll talk through your career goals and your portfolio examples

VP Interview (Video) - 30 minutes  

* 
Panel Interview with Real-Time Exercise (Video) - 60 minutes  
* 
+ The call will be split into two parts:
- You'll receive a prompt and talk through potential design options and solutions live on the spot
- You'll get some time to interact with team members you haven't met yet

### **What's it like to be a part of NeuraFlash?**


* Remote & In-Person: Whether you work out of our HQ in Massachusetts, one of our regional hubs, our India office, or you're one of over half of our NeuraFlash Family who work remotely, we're focused on keeping everyone connected and unified as one team.
* Travel: Get ready to pack your bags and hit the road! For certain roles, travel is an exciting part of the job, with an anticipated travel commitment of up to 25%. So, if you have a passion for adventure and don't mind a little jet-setting, this opportunity could be your ticket to exploring new places while making a positive impact on clients.
* Flexibility: Do you have to take the dog to the vet, pick up the kids from school, or the in-laws from the airport? We know that a perfect 9-5 isn't possible. So you have to jump out to do any of those, no problem! We build a culture of trust and understanding. We value good work not the hours in which you get it done
* Collaboration: You have a voice here! If you work with a team of smart people like we do, it's a no-brainer to take suggestions and feedback on how to keep NeuraFlash thriving. Our executive team holds town halls & company meetings where they address any suggestions or questions asked, no matter how big or small.
* Celebrate Often: We take our work seriously, but we don't take ourselves too seriously. Whether it is an arm wrestling contest, costume party, or ugly holiday sweaters our teams love to have fun. And while we work hard, we don't forget to slow down and celebrate the big things and the small things together.

### **The "Flashy" Perks:**


* Be in the right space: Work at the forefront of AI & Innovation on the Salesforce and AWS Platforms.
* Growth: In 2023, we grew our team by 21%, and we plan to do the same again this year! There's no limit to where your career at NeuraFlash can go.
* L&D Program: We are invested in your success. This program was built to help our employees advance in their career in Salesforce and at NeuraFlash.
* The Buddy Program: Each new team member is assigned a mentor to help them acclimate at NeuraFlash.
* Monthly & Weekly Socials: We hold monthly & weekly virtual socials to have more opportunities to be together.


*Location: NeuraFlash strives to provide you with the flexibility to work in the location that makes the most sense for your lifestyle. For those that prefer an office setting, this role may be based in any of our hub locations within the United States, and India. If you prefer to work from your home, we can accommodate remote locations anywhere in the United States for our U.S. based employees, anywhere within British Columbia and Ontario for our Canadian employees, and anywhere within Colombia for our Colombian based employees!*

title: Visual Designer
description:
**Role:** Visual Designer III


**Reports to:** VP of Product Marketing


**Department:** Product Marketing


**Location:** Remote, US


**Job Type:** Full Time, Exempt

  


**Help us Shape the Future of Data**



With more than 40 million users, Anaconda is the world's most popular data science platform and the foundation of modern AI development. We pioneered the use of Python for data science, championed its vibrant community, and continue to steward open-source projects that make tomorrow's innovations possible. Our enterprise-grade solutions enable corporate, research, and academic institutions around the world to harness the power of open-source for competitive advantage, groundbreaking research, and a better world.



Anaconda is seeking people who want to play a role in shaping the future of enterprise machine learning and data science. Candidates should be knowledgeable and capable, but always eager to learn more and to teach others. Overall, we strive to create a culture of ability and humility and an environment that is both fast-paced and focused. We stress empathy and collaboration with our customers, open-source users, and each other.



Here is why people love most about working here: We're not just a company, we're part of a movement. Our dedicated employees and user community are democratizing data science and creating and promoting open-source technologies for a better world, and our commercial offerings make it possible for enterprise users to leverage the most innovative output from open source in a secure, governed way.


**Summary**



Anaconda is seeking a talented **Visual Designer** **III** to join our rapidly-growing company. This is an excellent opportunity for you to leverage your experience and skills and apply it to the world of data science and machine learning. As the Sr. Creative Designer you will combine your artistic talent with technical skills to visually communicate messages and create engaging and memorable experiences across a variety of mediums.


**What You'll Do:**


* Lead the design of marketing materials by providing creative/art direction for converting written or spoken ideas into a design that connects with our target audiences
* Set the bar for creative excellence and maintain consistency with oversight and execution of projects, including enablement of the creative process
* Develop and execute the research and strategy to further concepts that elevate the brand and generate demand for our technology solutions
* Create and deliver concepts and designs for ads, website, content, marketing campaigns, partner materials, events, social media, and internal and external brand assets, including sales pitch decks
* Collaborate and iterate with the Digital Marketing team as part of their agile workflow for all things web/digital
* Monitor creative performance of assets across all channels and ensure optimizations for conversion
* Manage third party agencies if needed
* Update and maintain internal databases for designs, photography, and video
* Schedule projects and define budget constraints


**What You Need:**


* Mastery in relevant tools/software: Miro, Figma (Software) · Graphic Design · Adobe Creative Suite · Photoshop · Book Design · Information Graphics · Adobe Illustrator · WordPress
* Excellent listener, communicator, and influencer who can work collaboratively across teams
* Creative flair and a strong ability to translate requirements into design
* Understanding of integrated marketing and where creative differs across complex buying journeys
* Organizational and time-management skills for meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment
* Team attitude: "I am not done, until WE are done"
* Embody our core values:
+ Great People
+ Great Product
+ Great Performance

* Care deeply about fostering an environment where people of all backgrounds and experiences can flourish


**What Will Make You Stand Out:**


* Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment
* Experience working in a open source or data science-oriented company
* Degree in design, fine arts, or a related field
* UX design certification

  


**Why You'll Like Working Here:**


* Unique opportunity to translate strong open source adoption and user enthusiasm into commercial product growth
* Dynamic company that rewards high performers
* On the cutting edge of enterprise application of data science, machine learning and AI
* Collaborative team environment that values multiple perspectives and clear thinking
* Employees-first culture
* Flexible working hours
* Medical\\*, Dental\\*, Vision\\*, HSA\\*, Life\\* and 401K\\*
* Paid parental leave - both parents

title: UX Product Designer
description:
UX Product Designer **Who We Are**
SewerAI is revolutionizing an antiquated industry. We use AI and cloud technology to transform the way cities across North America maintain their sewer infrastructure, making communities safer and water cleaner. We are a Series B, investor-backed startup with many prominent, paying customers. Our Web application and AI/machine learning tools are in real-world use in environments ranging from large engineering firms to sewer inspection vans parked on city streets. **Who are we looking for?**
We are seeking a Product Designer to be a champion for our customers and own the user experience for our complex, B2B web application. In our first several years in the market we have demonstrated to the wastewater inspection industry what modern, cloud software can look like and deliver. We have created a cohort of loyal evangelists. Now, we need to ensure that a growing user base has clean, positive experiences with our software day in and day out. As we introduce new products that nobody else offers and prioritize requests from our diverse B2B customers, we want you to help us clearly define and prioritize UX problems. You must be collaborative and an effective communicator, but very much ready to lead. You love to talk to users and understand their day to day experiences. You are strong in big picture thinking and formulating novel approaches. You are diligent about information hierarchy, discoverability, and intuitiveness. You are also detail-oriented, ensuring we consider all the edge cases and user paths. Internally, you will make strong cases for why we need to tackle certain problems and how to approach them. You will engage actively and daily with Product, Engineering, the CEO and our Customer Success teams. You will also You have to work well within a small, dynamic, remote team - your core interactions will be about 10 people in a company of 40 - but also be able to create your own priorities and work independently. Experience designing complex Web applications is required, and an understanding of infrastructure, government, industry, field / edge applications, and AI/ML would be viewed favorably. **What will you do?*** -Interface with our users consistently and engagingly. Make use of our loyal user base, regular customer meetings, and in-app chat to understand everything possible about our customers’ needs. Capitalize on an internal core of users who utilize the application every day to execute their work. While the focus of the role is not structured research, be prepared to interview lots of users. Create detailed user flows, wireframes, and prototypes to address user, product, and business needs. Manage the complexities of our product in your design work.
* -Dig into our product analytics and live logging sessions to understand customer behavior.
* -Define pain points in the customer journey.
* -Collaborate with the Head of Product to brainstorm, evaluate, and prioritize products and features. Help carry them from ideas to experiments to UX wireframes to prototypes and mockups.
* -Help define the need for additional design resources. Briefing, selecting and managing freelance designers or researchers in support of this role.
* -Develop and maintain a comprehensive component library in collaboration with front-end engineers
* -Be a champion for good user experience and help us grow into our next phase of maturity as our user base explodes.

 **Specifically what we’re looking for**
-Bachelors’ degree5+ years as a Product Designer or similar title* -Coherent portfolio of software design projects, with SaaS and business to business (B2B) experience required.
* -Government/enterprise experience strongly preferred.
* -Highly skilled in carrying product features from brainstorming to UX wireframes to low fidelity UI mockups
* -Experience contributing to a design system featuring reusable components
* -Experience creating and testing clickable prototypes
* -Experience at a smaller, fast-moving organization where collaboration and communication are highly valued and you are expected to make your voice heard
* -Experience working with the front-end engineering team and sensitivity to implementation constraints
* -Commitment to modern software development practices such as source control, continuous integration/continuous deployment, automated testing, and agile development

 **Location**
SewerAI is headquartered in Walnut Creek, CA.
**Salary & Perks*** -Tools you need to get the job done
* -Competitive salary and equity-based remuneration
* -Benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, Basic Life, 401K and much mor
* -Stock Options
* -Unlimited PTO
* -Budget for courses, books, conferences – your development is important to us
* -Friendly, dynamic team all rowing in the same direction
* -Leadership in the role

title: Lead/Sr. UX Designer - Contract
description:
**Location:***Remote.*

**Who We Are**


We are an Experience design and trusted creative technology partner to some of the world’s most ambitious brands such as Google, Amazon, Meta and Uber. We believe in the power of storytelling, human-centric design, and the intersection of creativity with code to further humanity's relationship with technology. We operate fully remote, and our team members enjoy the flexibility of working from anywhere within the U.S. and Canada time zones while keeping a balanced relationship with their personal life.


At Left Field Labs, our curiosity drives us to seek out uncommon solutions to our shared challenges. Our purpose is to positively impact the human experience with everything we invent. We’re looking for those who can craft unique solutions through empathy.

  

Interested in joining a culture that celebrates diversity, encourages curiosity, and creates with purpose? Are you the kind of person who obsesses over details, thrives in a collaborative environment, and jumps at the opportunity to take on new challenges? Confident that you’re at the top of your game and ready to invent with others who are at the top of theirs? Check out our open position and let’s talk.

**Who We Are Seeking**


We’re looking for someone with an extensive background crafting UX strategy, shaping UX design and research processes, confidently presenting creative ideas to clients, mentoring more junior UX-ers, and with the ability to do hands-on UX work in a pinch. You will be working closely with a large, cross-disciplinary team of creatives, production experts, and engineers.


You will work closely with your project team to satisfy client requirements that produce high-quality deliverables. A positive attitude and outlook are a necessity, as well excellent, clear communication and professionalism. Organization and thoughtfulness will be the key qualities in everything you do, while focusing on a sense of timeliness and ownership. Every step of the way, you’ll have the opportunity to provide digital expertise and experience.

**What You’ll Do**

* Lead and oversee UX project work for one of LFL’s major verticals with ownership over the process, scope, and deliverables for the user experience research and design
* Manage, mentor, and provide oversight for UX designer(s) and UX researcher(s) and ensure a high quality and UX deliverables
* Translate client requirements and objectives into actionable product/experience requirements, user stories, user journeys, site/system maps and wireframes
* Persuasively present UX thinking and logical solutions to peers and clients, with an open mind for collaboration and respect for diverse perspectives
* Participate and lead early stage ideation sessions and UX workshops and work closely with visual and engineering teams to translate larger problems and conceptual approaches into actionable, implementable design solutions
* Assist the sales teams on new business opportunities and strategy for pitches and proposals
* Work with production and accounts teams to ensure that user experience design deadlines and client expectations are met and exceeded
* Provide guidance and perspective on the best user research methods for answering open design questions and getting feedback from potential users in order to validate and provide recommendations
* Work with production to define internal workflows that enable operational efficiency and quality outputs and help source and manage UX team resources for projects in this vertical (including external UX vendors and freelancers as needed)

 **What You’ll Need to be Successful**

* 5+ years of professional experience architecting user experience research, strategy and design including hands on implementation work, as well as working with and mentoring other UX designers and researchers
* Proven experience leading the UX process - from user research and brief to initial experience concepts to wireframes to technical documentation
* Strong understanding of fundamental design principles, typography, visual hierarchy, and usability and accessibility best practices and ability to apply those to execute clean and elegant design and documentation
* Specialized knowledge of UX/design software (specifically Figma) with an understanding of and ability to build designs using components and libraries and prototype
* UX research experience including planning and conducting user testing and initial audience/positioning research and strategy OR experience working with UX researchers to define test parameters and needs
* Top notch communications skills including the ability to articulately present and defend UX ideas and concepts
* Strong online portfolio showing UX concepts and strategies you created and working examples of those ideas in execution
* Master’s Degree or equivalent work experience

**Bonus**

* A multi-disciplinary background combining design with psychology, computer-science, specialized user-experience focused program or a related field is a major plus
* Experience working in an agency setting with global clients
* Basic understanding of HTML/CSS, other programming languages, or creative technology tools a plus


The salary range for this role is $60-$90 per hour. This range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in Culver City, California. This is the lowest to highest salary we reasonably and in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, performance, and business or organizational needs.


Left Field Labs is an E-Verify employer. E-Verify is an Internet based system operated by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) in partnership with the Social Security Administration (SSA) that allows participating employers to electronically verify the employment eligibility of their newly hired employees in the United States.


Please click on the following links for more information: E-Verify Participation Poster. For more information visit the USCIS’ website: http://www.uscis.gov/e-verify/employees




Left Field Labs is an equal opportunity employer and committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all applicants and team members regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, handicap, veteran status, marital status, criminal history, or any other category protected by applicable federal and state law, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance relating to an applicant's criminal history (LAMC 189.00). Left Field Labs makes reasonable accommodations for handicapped and disabled team members.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
**This position is remote based.**
----------------------------------


Are you a seasoned UI/UX designer who wants a job that serves a larger purpose? Are you interested in making a meaningful, life-changing difference for millions of students? Digication is changing the way students learn from the ground up. Instead of rote learning through lectures and tests, Digication allows students to create online portfolios - collaborative and safe learning spaces - to encourage project-based learning. Campuses report that sustained ePortfolio usage leads to higher levels of student success, including significant increases in pass rates, GPA, and retention rates. Digication is now being used by students at over 7,000 K-12 and Higher Education schools.


**Some of your responsibilities**
---------------------------------


* Work closely with a CEO and CoFounder led product team across all products
* Create and maintain UI and UX that is beautiful, intuitive, responsive, and accessible (WCAG 2.1)
* Collaborate with technical team to create new features or entirely new products that use consistent visual language
* Manage large amount of UI components across hundreds of screens in an organized, efficient, and error free manner


**Your skills**
---------------


* Hands-on experience as a **UI / UX designer of at least 3 years with complex single-page applications**
* Expert level UI / UX design skills with deep understanding of user behaviors while balancing technical limitations in modern web applications
* Excellent knowledge of how modern web applications work
* Great written and verbal skills, just like every great communicator ;-)


**Our culture**
---------------


* We work remotely and employees are distributed throughout the world.
* We work as a team, with direct access to the company founders.
* We are self motivated, hold ourselves accountable for our work and commitments.
* Although we work with a sense of urgency, we don't like cutting corners.
* Integrity is more important for us then profitability (although we are profitable!).
* We are not a “work hard/play hard” startup but responsible adults with diverse backgrounds and interests who take our mission, our clients and our lives seriously.
* We value personal growth and learning over titles and salaries.


**Perks at Digication**
-----------------------


* **Work wherever you want.** If you want to move, travel, experience the world, do it while having a full time job with us.
* There is one team meeting a day and one company-wide all-hands meeting once a week. Otherwise you work at your own pace.
* We connect via Slack and Zoom, and use Figma for all design related work.
* We will get you whatever computer / phone / tablet you see fit.
* Last and not least, you get to work with on a product that makes a difference for students at thousands of schools and colleges. See what our users say about us: https://www.youtube.com/channe... (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCiSdYblDWvWUccKA9zBIV4Q/videos)


**The Hiring Process**
----------------------


* **Application**: Provide us with the following: a cover letter, resume, link to your portfolio (please make sure you include screenshots of web applications you have designed)
* **Work Sample**: Within 48 hours of the application, we will let you know whether we would like you to work on our small work sample. This shouldn't take you longer than 2-3 hours.
* **Video interview**: Upon successful review of your work sample, we will schedule a video interview with you. This interview is intended to gauge the general cultural fit, communication, and general UI/UX design skills.
* **Group Meeting**: Get a chance to meet some more Digication peeps.
* **Job offer**: We will let you know within 5 business days from the group interview whether you will be offered the position.

title: Product Designer
description:
**About GrowthLoop**



GrowthLoop is the leading Composable Customer Data Platform (Composable CDP) that empowers marketers to efficiently build audience segments, orchestrate cross-channel journeys, and assess campaign results directly on their Data Cloud. In contrast to traditional MarTech Stacks, characterized by closed ecosystems and data redundancy, the New MarTech Stack is open, orchestrated, and committed to zero data duplication. GrowthLoop serves as the gateway to this innovative landscape, offering centralized control over data and intelligence, freeing teams from vendor lock-in, and fostering an environment of channel innovation.



We apply best-in-class architecture and technology to build a system for marketing teams that is both functional and beautiful.


**Our Mission**



Unlock the value of your data to make it drive massive, positive, real-world impact.


**How we work**


* We bring a Learner's mindest to everything we do.
* We encourage exploration of new technologies and ownership to drive them.
* We believe in the power of collaboration, innovation and gratitude.
* Our love for our customers drives us to go the extra mile and build the best products for them.
* We ship with urgency and extreme ownership.
* Our culture and people are our greatest strength.


**About the Position**



We're seeking a versatile and talented Product Designer to join our growing team. You thrive in lean startup environments and are eager to see your impact, as we build a category-defining product.



As our founding Product Designer, you will partner closely with our Product Founder and CTO to lead and execute the design of user experience and platform interfaces, across our solution. You will challenge assumptions, consider non-obvious alternatives, and drive elegant simplicity for our users.


**Responsibilities**


* Develop and maintain a deep understanding of our target users, their needs, and pain points, and advocate for user-driven decision-making.
* Refine your design solutions in response to user feedback, market trends, and evolving technical requirements.
* Create and maintain design systems including wireframes, mockups, UI prototypes, and specifications.
* Collaborate closely with Product to pinpoint design challenges and craft sophisticated solutions.
* Work with Engineering to review the implementation of designs and contribute to quality assurance.
* Analyze user onboarding, engagement, and retention data to improve the overall product experiences.
* Serve as a Design thought leader and subject-matter expert across teams, to drive a user-centered design vision and strategy. Apply strategic thinking to communicate the value of essential solutions.
* Make the complex simple for our customers. Seize the opportunity to make a data cloud product into something so simple, that every business team can activate value from it in minutes.


**Qualifications**


* 5+ years of experience in SaaS software design
* Domain experience in designing complex marketing or data technology solutions.
* The ability to balance an iterative approach and urgency to solve customer pain, while shipping high-quality designs and building for scale.
* SQL Understanding. To make data simple to activate for our customers, you need to understand both data and our customers well enough to translate through design.
* Demonstrated success in a startup environment.
* Strong understanding of how design, product, and engineering can work together to expedite the delivery of high-quality experiences efficiently and at scale.


The estimated salary for this role is $130,000-$145,000 USD. This role is also eligible for equity. Final base salary decisions will be based on a variety of non-discriminatory factors, such as the individual's performance, experience, and qualifications.


**Benefits of joining our team**



Rewards


* See your work impact some of the largest businesses in the world
* Spot bonuses for major milestones and product feature graduations
* Grow into leadership roles as we scale the company
* Equity incentives for employees making an impact


Flexible Work Style


* Flexible remote work policies
* Flexible schedules and goal-based workstyle
* Unlimited vacation policy
* Monthly Recharge Days


Platinum Benefits


* Free Platinum Health Insurance with Aetna
* 401(k) Program with Generous Company Match
* Flexible PTO and WFH Policies


Learn and Grow


* Quarterly Hackathons to focus on team passion projects
* Education Stipend towards your professional development
* Work directly with Founders
* Learners' mindset culture


*GrowthLoop is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: UI/UX Designer III
description:

* Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and creativity, where you can be on the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you're interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to crafting an ambitious and inclusive work environment, join client – a company you can be proud to be with.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Create conversation flows, scripts, and user personas to guide the development of conversational interfaces **Conduct user research and testing to ensure conversational interfaces are effective and engaging** Continuously improve conversational interfaces based on user feedback and data analysis **Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in conversational design and AI technology**

**Requirements:**

**Experience with the following topics will be considered a plus:**

If you are a creative thinker with a passion for designing engaging and effective conversational experiences, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

title: UX Designer
description:
As a UX Designer at Data Society, you will be responsible for working directly with customers to uncover their goals and transform them into usable, accessible, highly functional and delightful interactive experiences. You will work closely with product managers and our development team to create clickable wireframes, mockups, functional requirements and finished products. You should understand basic HTML and CSS, and while coding skills are not required, you should have a good understanding of how web technologies like single page React apps, component libraries, APIs, and Databases work and how to design with them in mind.  

  

You should be comfortable working in an agile environment, and familiar with concepts like scrums, sprints, story refinement, and demo days.  

  

**Responsibilities*** Lead discovery sessions for new projects and create user stories from them.
* Create UX artifacts like personas and customer journeys.
* Create low-fidelity clickable wireframes, present them to customers for feedback, and test them with representative future users.
* Write functional requirements from your user stories and wireframes with product managers and developers.
* Create high-fidelity clickable mockups, present them to customers for feedback, and test them with representative future users.
* Work closely with the development team to answer design questions and create or change designs as needed. We operate on the principle that the fastest way to solve an engineering problem is often design, and the fastest way to solve a design problem is often engineering.

  

**Skills you bring*** You are very experienced with Figma. We use it for our design work.
* You have some experience in Adobe products like Illustrator and Photoshop.
* You are familiar with the difference between low and high fidelity designs.
* You understand usability and how to create web products that are visually appealing but also intuitive.
* You have significant experience with accessibility, and how to design for it. We strive for full 508 and WCAG compliance.
* You have experience in responsive design, and how to create designs that work well at any screen size.
* You can communicate professionally with customers and users while gathering requirements and testing designs.
* You have at minimum a basic understanding of HTML and CSS, and how they are used to turn designs into web pages and applications.
* Experience with JavaScript and React are considered strong pluses. This role isn’t required to write code, but knowing how your designs will be built is always helpful, as is being able to write or edit code yourself.
* You will need to be able to open Visual Studio, pull the latest code from our repo, and run it locally so you can help check how your designers were implemented. Basic familiarity with how Git and branches work is a strong plus.


A portfolio or collection of past work is expected for this position. It can be shared privately if you don’t or can't share it on a live website.


The ideal candidate for this role is located within the Continental US and able to work on EST hours. This position is able to be fully remote for the right candidate. Current salary range is $90,000-$110,000 though we are open to negotiation. This position is eligible for full benefits including health, medical, dental, short and long-term disability, and life insurance, as well as our 401k, transit subsidy, unlimited PTO, and 15 paid holidays during 2024.  

  

**Affirmative Action Statement**  

  

At Data Society, we don't just accept differences - we celebrate them, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. Data Society is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.  

  

**We do not accept unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters.**

title: UX Designer
description:
**Role:** UX Designer


**Reports to:** Sr. UX Manager


**Department:** Product Marketing


**Location:** Remote, US


**Job Type:** Full Time, Exempt

  


**Be at the center of AI**

  



With more than 40 million users, Anaconda is the world's most popular data science platform and the foundation of modern AI development. We pioneered the use of Python for data science, championed its vibrant community, and continue to steward open-source projects that make tomorrow's innovations possible. Our enterprise-grade solutions enable corporate, research, and academic institutions around the world to harness the power of open-source for competitive advantage, groundbreaking research, and a better world.



Anaconda is seeking people who want to be at the center of Artificial Intelligence. Candidates should be knowledgeable and capable, but always eager to learn more and to teach others.



Anaconda is seeking a talented **UX Designer** to join our growing company. This is an excellent opportunity to leverage your design skills and apply them to the world of data science and machine learning. As our **UX Designer** you will play a pivotal role in shaping the user experience for our public-facing website, landing pages, marketing campaigns, and other top-of-funnel initiatives. It is crucial that you not only possess UX design expertise but also have a deep understanding of marketing principles and strategies.

  


**What You'll Do:**


* Collaborate with marketing teams to ensure that UX design aligns seamlessly with marketing objectives and initiatives.
* Utilize your marketing experience to optimize user journeys, enhance user engagement, and drive conversions, including email marketing initiatives tied to the user journey and experience
* Act as the voice of the user, championing user-centric design principles throughout the design process.
* Design, validate, and iterate on concepts based on user feedback, working closely with UX Researchers to gather and interpret user data.
* Work collaboratively with the UX team to define and shape the Anaconda experience, ensuring consistency and coherence across all touchpoints.
* Align design direction with overall product strategy and apply it effectively to marketing initiatives.
* Create comprehensive user flows, wireframes, low and high-fidelity mockups, and clickable prototypes to effectively communicate design concepts.
* Partner with engineers to implement designs efficiently and accurately, ensuring a seamless transition from design to development.
* Translate project requirements into designs that leverage the Anaconda design system, maintaining consistency and scalability across all projects.
* Contribute to the development and refinement of information architecture and product taxonomy, enhancing usability and findability for our users.
* Identify and address UX problems, including issues related to accessibility, usability, and overall user experience.
* Facilitate communication among stakeholders to maintain alignment and awareness of project goals, progress, and challenges.

  


**What You Need:**


* Proven experience as a UX Designer with a focus on marketing initiatives, including email marketing programs tied to user journeys.
* Strong understanding of user flows, information architecture, and optimizing user journeys.
* Proficiency in creating user flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes using tools such as Figma and Adobe CC.
* Experience working with design systems and translating requirements into designs that leverage existing systems.
* Knowledge of UX best practices, including accessibility standards and principles.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
* Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Marketing, or a related field (or equivalent work experience)

  


**What Will Make You Stand Out:**


* Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment
* Experience working in a open source or data science-oriented company
* A stellar portfolio showcasing strong interaction and visual design skills
* Experience with CSS, HTML, and other web technologies
* Experience with Adobe CC tools.
* Previous experience in the data science/analytics/big data field
* Previous experience designing multi-sided marketplaces
* Team attitude: "I am not done, until WE are done"
* Embody our core values:
	+ Great People
	+ Great Product
	+ Great Performance
* Care deeply about fostering an environment where people of all backgrounds and experiences can flourish

  


**Why You'll Like Working Here:**


* Unique opportunity to translate strong open source adoption and user enthusiasm into commercial product growth
* Dynamic company that rewards high performers
* On the cutting edge of enterprise application of data science, machine learning and AI
* Collaborative team environment that values multiple perspectives and clear thinking
* Employees-first culture
* Flexible working hours
* Medical\\*, Dental\\*, Vision\\*, HSA\\*, Life\\* and 401K\\*
* Paid parental leave - both parents
* Monthly productivity stipend
* Pre-IPO stock options
* Open vacation policy\\*
* Quarterly Snake days (company wide bonus day off)
* 100% remote


* FTE employees based on your region

description:

Remote (Latin America)

 **Company Snapshot**
