title: UX Designer
description:
**About the Position**  

As a UX Designer at Flywheel, you'll join our busy and growing UX team to support our best-in-class biomedical research platform. You'll help define end-to-end user experiences, from researching the problem space to shaping the innovative UI design that brings the product to life. You’ll tackle complex, data-heavy customer workflows and craft them into intuitive, accessible interfaces for our customers around the globe.  

**Environment**  

We're highly responsive to customer needs and constantly strive to positively contribute to the biomedical and life sciences communities we serve. We value collaborative people with a strong drive to simplify complex problems, a solid foundation in UX design heuristics, and a customer-centered approach to designing software for people. We also appreciate self-motivated, creative individuals who work well in a collaborative environment – constantly generating and sharing new ideas and solutions with the team.

Flywheel has a comprehensive benefits package and encourages a balanced work life and home life.
### **Responsibilities**

* Create design assets for our web application. This includes wireframes, low to high-fidelity visual design mockups, prototypes, and supporting design specifications and documentation.
* Collaborate closely with engineering and product management to ensure your proposed designs meet user needs and are feasible to implement.
* Conduct user research with stakeholders and end-users to help shape your designs.
* Be the voice of our end-users, ensuring they are represented at every step in the design process and that we are correctly elevating their needs and pain points.
* Effectively speak to process, design goals, and team vision as a strong representative and advocate for the UX Design team.
* Stay up to date with the latest design patterns, trends, and tools.

### **What Would Make You a Great Fit**

* BA/BFA degree in HCI or design-related field, emphasizing user experience, interaction design, visual design, psychology, or related field.
* 3 or more years working as a UX or Product Designer.
* A portfolio showcasing your processes and deliverables. We are interested in learning how you approach problems and think through them. The portfolio should demonstrate UX\\UI design best practices, responsive and interaction design, and conducting user research and how they informed your designs.
* Some experience conducting usability research such as moderated/unmoderated usability testing, user interviews, surveys, and other research methods.
* Fluency with modern UX design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD. We use Figma.
* You are a curious, humble, self-motivated, and creative individual who thrives in a collaborative yet dynamic and sometimes ambiguous startup working environment.

**Do you feel like you don't have everything that's listed above? If you have some of the skills and experience that we’re looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply!** **About Us**  

Flywheel is the leading research data platform that's transforming the way biomedical and imaging data are managed at leading life sciences, clinical, and academic institutions globally.  

Flywheel provides a comprehensive research data solution with all the tools needed for curation, imaging processing, machine learning workflows, and secure collaboration. By leveraging cloud scalability and automating research workflows, Flywheel helps organizations scale research data and analysis, improve scientific collaboration, and accelerate discoveries. **Company Values**  

GO STEADY WITH LEVITY
The alchemy of effective teamwork happens when we each take ownership of both the menial and the magical every day. We’re serious, but never stuffy. We keep our cool under pressure because we assume best intentions and maintain perspective. This allows for true teamwork, with a dash of irreverence.  

  

WORK BETTER TOGETHER
We are tenacious and united in our pursuit of solving our customers’ biggest challenges, and no challenge is too big. Diverse backgrounds across our team make us more effective as we listen, absorb, collaborate, and iterate to innovate.  

FIGURE IT OUT
We’re obsessed with uncovering the why of any given. Having an open mind allows us to be quick to fail and quick to adapt. We relentlessly pursue continual improvement through learning and imagining new possibilities.  

  

GIVE A SHIT
We’re fueled by grit, boundless energy, and a deep belief that we are doing cool shit. We don’t hesitate to stand up and speak out because we trust that through tough, honest discourse we can drive change and make a real difference for our customers and our mission.

title: Product Designer
description:
**About Peggy**
===============


Peggy is reenvisioning the art market by establishing Art 2.0. Our mission is to give everyone access to art. What does this mission look like materialized? A world with art in every home. Peggy creates new opportunities within the art market by making contemporary art accessible, filling the untapped gap of resale activity in the middle market and shifting benefits to artists by enabling resale royalties.


Being on the frontier takes visionary thinking, a flexible mindset and the ability to thrive in chaos. We value security, storytelling, straightforwardness and forward-thinking. Peggy is the place for you if you’re seeking personal and professional growth and to establish a new way of doing business in the art market.


As a seed-stage startup, Peggy does not offer a rigid corporate structure. If you crave the structure, clarity and predictability of traditional corporate environments, Peggy might not be a place where you’ll thrive. We operate in an ambiguous environment by being curious, placing bets, shipping fast and learning from the outcomes. We are light on processes at Peggy, instead favouring relationships of high trust achieved through high impact. At our stage, exceptional competencies centre around leading, owning and prioritizing work that achieves business strategies.

**About the Role**
==================


As a Product Designer at Peggy, you'll play a pivotal role in crafting the user experience for our innovative marketplace. You'll work closely with the executive and product teams to establish and implement design principles that result in a visually stunning platform that enhances the way people engage with contemporary art. If you have a strong design sensibility, an eye for detail, and a desire to shape the future of art world, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

**Your Responsibilities**
-------------------------

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and prioritize product features and enhancements.
* Develop and implement design principles to shape the in-app user experience.
* Create user-centred designs, including wireframes, mockups, and prototypes, that align with our brand and mission.
* Ensure a consistent and delightful user experience across all Peggy platforms, including the web experience.
* Stay up-to-date with design trends, user interface standards, and emerging technologies.
* Work closely with engineers to ensure the successful implementation of designs.
* Continuously improve and optimize existing product features based on user feedback and data analysis.
* Champion user-centered design principles throughout the organization.

**Your Profile**
----------------

* 3+ years of proven experience as a Product Designer with a strong portfolio showcasing your design skills.
* Experience working in mobile app design.
* Proficient in using Figma.
* Knowledge of user-centered design principles.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities.
* Passion for contemporary art is a plus, but not mandatory.

**Benefits**
============

* Competitive salary and stock options
* 5 weeks vacation (which includes 2 weeks of company downtime during the holiday season)
* Digital-first, fully remote environment

**Working at Peggy**
====================

* Remote first/remote only
* Peggy is based in Canada
* Eastern Time or Central European Time is preferred for this role

title: UX Website Content Strategist/Content Designer
description:
**Patterson isn't just a place to work, it's a partner that cares about your success.**


One of the distinguishing marks of our company is the talented people who embrace the people-first, always advancing, and results-driven culture. Professional growth abounds in this motivating environment. We value the diverse talents and experiences our employees bring to Patterson and believe that they build a stronger and successful organization.


The UX Website Content Strategist/Content Designer applies and updates existing UX strategies to accommodate changes to the company’s websites and migrations across platforms. The UX Website Content Strategist/Content Designer assesses website content needs, recommends solutions and stewards the content for multiple websites (primarily B2B) across business units.

* Cultivate strong relationships with UX team members, marketing managers, writers and designers, collaborating to deliver relevant content to the intended audience in the right way, in the right place, at the right time. Relationship building especially with the marketing teams is essential.
* Drive, advocate and embody a customer-centric perspective
* Align deliverables with the established UX strategy across websites
* Collaborate with UX team members, marketing managers, writer and designers to produce deliverables at a project level:
* Identify the content demands for website projects
* Determine where on the website and on the page the proposed content should go, watching for cross-linking opportunities
* Select the CMS design patterns that will present the content in the most engaging way
* Prepare content documents, based on text from writers and images from the designers, that provide clear instructions for the CMS content author
* Review images from designers to ensure they are sized properly and align with the UX strategy
* Write meta data and alt tags to optimize pages for search engines
* Review built content for errors and document corrections that are needed

**A****dditional functions**


In addition to the essential functions listed above, the incumbent may perform the following additional functions.


* Conduct research using Conductor to identify opportunities for optimizing content for search engines, to write meta data and alt tags, and to establish the URL
* Collaborate with the analytics team and review G4 and Full Story data to identify opportunities to increase user engagement with the content and increase conversions
* Organize and manage migrations of websites from one platform to another
* Conduct content audits and content-focused usability audits
* Write UX-related e-commerce content such as tip tools and instructions
* Communicate a common understanding of content responsibilities and expectations across people and teams
* Identify and escalate deliverables/issues to the UX manager
* Bring contemporary thinking, techniques and style to auditing, analyzing and articulating the delta between current state and ideal state
* Some content authoring within the CMS may be necessary

**Required Qualifications**

* 5+ years of UX content strategy/design or similar role in the B2B space
* Fluency in digital content best practices: you know how to work with a CMS and how to structure content so it can be easily consumed and understood. You have a sophisticated understanding of contemporary web writing, on-page SEO and content design techniques, and you feel comfortable sharing your expertise with colleagues.
* Solid understanding of keyword research for SEO and beyond
* Comfort balancing the priorities of marketing managers with users’ needs
* Clear understanding of information architecture: You are comfortable developing and documenting information architecture recommendations for websites,
* of sites and individual pages.
* Exceptional attention to detail
* Ability to work independently (mostly remotely) and adapt to changing project needs


**Preferred Qualifications**

* Strong organizing skills
* Solid problem-solving skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills

**What's In It For You:**


We provide competitive benefits, unique incentive programs and rewards for our eligible employees:

* Full Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits and an integrated Wellness Program.
* 401(k) Match Retirement Savings Plan.
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP).
* Paid Time Off (PTO).
* Holiday Pay & Floating Holidays.
* Volunteer Time Off (VTO).
* Educational Assistance Program (Tuition Reimbursement).
* Full Paid Parental and Adoption Leave.
* LifeWorks (Employee Assistance Program).
* Patterson Perks Program.

**EEO Statement**
-----------------


As a people-first company, Patterson promotes a culture that embodies and celebrates diversity and inclusivity. We believe our employees’ unique experiences and differences is what strengthens us and drives our success. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.


We are Patterson. We welcome you.

title: Staff Product Designer-Platform UX
description:
Apollo.io is the leading go-to-market solution for revenue teams, trusted by over 500,000 companies and millions of users globally, from rapidly growing startups to some of the world's largest enterprises. Apollo.io provides sales and marketing teams with easy access to verified contact data for over 270 million B2B contacts, along with tools to engage and convert these contacts in one unified platform. By helping revenue professionals find the most accurate contact information and automating the outreach process, Apollo.io turns prospects into customers. Apollo raised a series D in 2023 and is backed by top-tier investors, including Sequoia Capital, Bain Capital Ventures, and more, and counts the former President and COO of Hubspot, JD Sherman, among its board members. Apollo.io is growing rapidly, with 900% revenue growth since 2021, and is looking for world-class talent to keep building with us.


**The Role**



We are hiring aStaff Product Designer to help craft the future of Apollo. Product Designers serve a vital role here in helping us learn, test, and iterate to build the best experiences possible for our users. We appreciate designers who think deeply, speak clearly, love collaboration and feedback, and are always learning about best practices to master their craft!



Our Product Managers, Design, and Engineering teams are structured as Squads that are focused on several core features of the product. You will be assigned to a Squad alongside one Product Manager and multiple Engineers. You will also regularly collaborate with designers from other pods to share learnings and ensure a cohesive user experience.


**Responsibilities**


* Working with the Product Manager on your squad to help brainstorm, build & validate solutions to user problems & goals.
* Working with Engineers on your squad to understand constraints, hand off designs, and run design QA.
* Collaborating with your squad during Weekly Sprint Planning & Daily Standups to ensure that we are building the best experience.
* Collaborating with other Designers to provide feedback, share + learn best practices & maintain a cohesive experience in the product.
* Interviewing users to validate designs & learn about user problems.
* Using & building upon our design system to update portions of your surface.
* Consistently integrating quantitative and qualitative data into essential product decisions.
* Collaborating with your squad to identify the highest impact areas to work on, develop hypothesis, test, and iterate


**Qualifications**


* 8+ years of experience designing and shipping complex web-based products founded in data and customer insights.
* You have expert design instincts & best practice knowledge to translate user problems, user goals, business objectives and technical constraints into excellent product experiences to deliver quick turnarounds & shorten feedback loops.
* You’re a self-starter that thrives while working in a fast-paced environment, working on multiple projects simultaneously.
* You have experience creating and maintaining components across multiple product surfaces in Figma.
* You are a voracious learner, constantly trying to learn how to improve customer experience, drive core metrics. Continuously learns new industry standards, staying up to date with how to get the most out of modern design tools including Figma.
* You have a passion for typography and copywriting and know how to write a simple, compelling microcopy to support your UI design.
* You’re experimentation-oriented – You have the ability to conduct user interviews, analyze the results of interviews, form hypothesis, test hypothesis with users via prototypes or product experimentation, and iterate.
* No big ego – we can uphold excellent rhythms within our Product Management, Engineering & Design squads because each member has respect for each other, and has a shared understanding of the goals, vision, and principles that Apollo operates on.
* You’re highly interested in user-centric design – we like to push each other to stay at the cutting edge of our field :)


**What You’ll Love About Apollo**



Besides the great compensation package and culture that thrives in openness and excellence, we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees’ careers. The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale. You’ll be a significant part of a lean, remote team, empowered to really own your role as a proactive educator. We’re very collaborative at Apollo, so you’ll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You’ll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you’ll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!

title: Product Designer (Remote)
description:
### **Job Description:**



We are seeking a talented and experienced Product Designer to join the Yembo Design team. This position is a unique opportunity to own the design and user experience of a consumer-facing product that revolutionizes home services with powerful AI functionality, while also working with the Design team to continue building and maintaining our design system, Yemblocks. A successful candidate will be excited and able to iterate and collaborate with our design, product, and technical teams, continuously enhancing our product's design and functionality as we continue to develop our AI product offerings and bring value to home service businesses and homeowners.


### **Key Responsibilities:**


* Lead the design of new features and updates to our flagship moving product
* Design user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups in collaboration with our product and engineering teams
* Work closely with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to create a seamless user experience for our products
* Collaborate with the design team to maintain and iterate on our design system
* Stay up-to-date with the latest design trends and technologies

### **Qualifications:**


* 3+ years of experience in product design, preferably in SaaS and/or B2B products
* Fluency in Figma
* Experience working in a fast-paced, collaborative, cross-disciplinary environment
* Experience using and iterating on a design system
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills
* Ability to fully own and manage design priorities across a product

#### **Preferred Skills/Bonus:**


* Experience with HTML/CSS and basic front-end development
* Experience creating and maintaining asset libraries
* Experience drawing and animating vectors
* Experience with user research and usability testing

**Salary: $90,000 + Benefits + Equity**
---------------------------------------


### **Benefits**


* 100% Employer Covered Health Care Plan for you and your family (Medical, Dental & Vision)
* Retirement Plan (We offer a 401k with 4% company match)
* Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
* Paid Time Off (Unlimited Flex PTO, Flexible Sick Leave & 11 National Holidays)
* Parental Leave for both caregivers
* Annual Events & Meetups
* Work From Home (Fully Remote Team)
* Stock Option Plan
* Learning & Development Opportunities
* ***Note: Health care, retirement and insurance benefits are currently available only for US employees.***


***If you don't meet all the requirements but think you would be a great fit for our team, we'd still love to meet you and encourage you to apply! Additionally, check out our*** ***careers page*** ***for more information on Yembo!***


### **Hiring Process**


 **What to Expect** **Duration**
  

**Apply to Role** Email from us with next steps 1 week
  

**HR Interview** Conversation on culture fit and expectations 25 mins
  

**Team Interview** Deep dive into role and technical questions 1.5 hours
  

**Complete Checks** Background and reference screening 1 week
  

**Receive Offer** Congrats! We want you on team Yembo!  


  

### **Notice**



Yembo is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, as Yembo does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation or any other classification protected by Federal, state, or local law.

  


**We are not accepting submissions from recruiting firms at this time.**

  



#LI-Remote



#BI-Remote

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
**UI/UX Designer**

**Who We Are**

TrueLearn is a rapidly growing ed-tech company committed to maximizing learner performance on high-stakes licensure exams. Our learning platform leverages fundamentals of cognition and data science to provide a connected experience between individual learners and their academic institutions seeking to maximize learning outcomes. We seek to be data-driven and customer-focused in all that we do. Our culture is built around authenticity, empowerment, and a shared mission to relentlessly advocate for our learners.

TrueLearn is seeking a UI/UX Designer to join the team! UI/UX Designers play a critical role in shaping the digital experiences that users interact with daily. They bridge the gap between aesthetics and functionality, ensuring that products not only look good but also provide meaningful and enjoyable experiences for users. The UI/UX Designer will be a subject matter expert in creating products that enhance a user’s experiences. This role is responsible for working with cross-functional teams to develop user-centered design solutions for all levels of products and digital initiatives using research/data to create wireframes, flows and prototypes.

**Position Summary**

The UI/UX Designer plays a crucial role in creating intuitive, visually appealing, and user-friendly digital products and interfaces. This role involves a combination of design and user research skills to ensure that products meet the needs and expectations of users while aligning with the business objectives of the company. The UI/UX Designer will be involved in setting design standards, mentoring other designers, and helping to shape the overall design strategy for a product or project.

**Responsibilities**

* Participate in user research activities such as competitive analysis, user interviews, surveys, and usability studies.
* Effectively communicate design concepts, strategy, and the rationale behind design decisions.
* Provide innovative solutions and guide others in the design process.
* Create user-centered designs by considering market & competitive analysis, customer feedback, and usability findings.
* Lead and define specifications for our products user interface and experience, ensuring that content and functionality are logically organized and intuitive for our users.
* Conduct concept and usability testing; gather and evaluate user feedback.
* Develop wireframes and interactive prototypes that outline the layout and functionality of digital interfaces, allowing for early testing, feedback and refinement of solutions.
* Collaborate with product, editorial, marketing, and engineering in an agile process.
* Ensure that digital products are accessible to all users, including those with disabilities, by adhering to accessibility standards and guidelines.
* Design interfaces that are responsive and adaptable to different screen sizes and devices.
* Keep up to date on industry trends, establish and advocate for UX/UI best practices, guidelines and standards, and emerging technologies; contribute to improvements in process and workflow.
* Maintain and contribute to product design systems.
* Participate in roadmap planning with the Product team.
* Collaborate with other designers to maintain design consistency and coherence across the product as appropriate.
* Support development, QA, and launch of products and feature iterations.

**Qualifications & Required Skills**

* A Bachelor’s degree in Design or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* 6+ years experience as a UX/UI Designer for mobile and web platforms, EdTech industry preferred.
* A strong online portfolio showcasing a range of UI/UX design projects.
* Knowledge of user research methodologies and usability principles with experience conducting user testing and interviews.
* Ability to understand and visualize complex user flows, interactions, and technical information.
* HTML and CSS knowledge and current on latest responsive design techniques.
* Familiarity with WCAG2 guidelines and implementation.
* Proficiency with Figma preferred.
* Previous experience working in an Agile environment.
* Excellent time management, communication skills (written and verbal), and team collaboration skills.
* Self-organized, detail-oriented, and self-motivated.
* Passion for identifying and solving real user problems.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Yearly bonus

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* UI/UX design: 6 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Product Designer (contract)
description:
**Product Designer (Contract)**

 *Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Microsoft through external staffing partners of Allegis Global Solutions. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by AGS and will not be an employee of Microsoft.*

 **Summary:**


The Bing Search & Design System team is looking for a Product Designer to help bring our projects to life. This role is for someone with strong design abilities, typographic skills, digital expertise, and acute attention to detail. You are a highly motivated, self-directed team player who works well under pressure and can thrive in a deadline-driven and fast-paced environment. Development of visual design concepts referencing our visual system and interface guidelines and sharing those with the visual system designers. You are also capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously. You are a great creator, collaborator, and communicator.  



  

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Lead collaborative design for your assigned product area across designers, researchers, product managers, and developers.
* Conduct or participate in basic research to understand the behaviors, motivations, and needs of our customers and then utilize this knowledge to develop relevant and impactful experiences.
* Work closely with product teams to understand strategic planning and ensure your work aligns to business goals while creating customer value.
* Draw upon your ability to map end-to-end experiences and ideate broadly to generate creative solutions to complex user scenarios and business needs.
* Propose creative solutions to complex problems.
* Utilize your strong interaction and visual design skills to create amazing product designs.
* Document final designs in a point-of-reference/specification, adjust design systems and work directly with engineers for implementation.

 **Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Design, Graphic Design, or related program. A combination of education and experience may substitute for a Bachelor's degree.
* 5-7+ years of visual UI design/Graphic design for website/mobile apps and work-related experience required.
* Have a good understanding of UX (user experience, web, and mobile interaction patterns). Strong visual/UI design skills.
* Ability to discuss and present an in-depth knowledge of standard design principles: color, typography, layout, brand.
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability to work under constant deadline constraints.
* Must have the ability to understand technology issues and communicate information effectively.
* Proficiency in current and emerging web technologies and standard design software packages (i.e. Figma)

Portfolio for a review with design lead.  
* 

  

**Additional Details:**

* Location: Remote
* Duration: 4 months
* Pay Range: $46.50 - 52.50 per hour

  



  

*AGS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.*

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
**About the Role**
==================

  

We are seeking a talented and experienced UI/ UX Designer to join our dynamic team. As a UI/ UX designer at Zero Hash, you will play a crucial role in shaping the user experience and interface design of our digital asset infrastructure products. You will work closely with cross-functional teams including product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to translate complex business requirements into intuitive and visually appealing designs. The ideal candidate is passionate about creating innovative solutions, has a keen eye for detail, and thrives in a fast-paced startup environment.


**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to define product requirements and design goals.
* Conduct user research, gather feedback, and analyze user behavior to inform design decisions.
* Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to visualize and communicate design concepts.
* Design intuitive user interfaces and interactive experiences across web and mobile platforms.
* Ensure consistency and coherence in design by establishing and maintaining design systems and guidelines.
* Iterate on designs based on user feedback, usability testing, and data-driven insights.
* Work closely with engineering teams to ensure successful implementation of designs while adhering to technical constraints.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in product design.


**Requirements**
----------------


* Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or related field. Master's degree is a plus.
* Proven experience (7 years) as a product designer, interaction designer, or similar role in a software development environment.
* Strong portfolio showcasing a range of design projects, with an emphasis on digital products and interfaces.
* Strong proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, or similar software.
* Solid understanding of user-centered design principles, usability, and accessibility standards.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to articulate and justify design decisions.


**Preferred**
-------------


* Experience working in agile development methodologies is preferred.
* Knowledge of blockchain technology and cryptocurrency is a plus.


**Benefits Offered**
--------------------


We believe a happy, motivated, and healthy team is the best way to succeed. We offer the following benefit


* Healthcare Insurance: Zero Hash covers roughly 100% of employee premiums (U.S. Only)
* Chance to earn equity
* Vision Insurance (US Only)
* Dental Insurance (US Only)
* Maternity & Paternity leave
* Visa sponsorship
* 401k (US Only)


**About Zero Hash**
-------------------


Zero Hash is a B2B embedded infrastructure platform that allows any platform to integrate digital assets natively into their own customer experience quickly and easily (a matter of API endpoints). We power neo-banks, broker-dealers, and payment groups to offer digital asset trading and custody, crypto-backed rewards and round-up programs.


Our thesis is very simple: every financial services firm will offer digital assets within the next 2 years and will do so through platforms such as Zero Hash. Zero Hash is defining the new FinTech vertical of crypto-as-a-service.


Clients include MoneyLion, Wirex, Deserve, MoonPay, Tastytrade. Backed by Point72 Ventures, NYCA, Bain Capital, Tastytrade.

  


**The Zero Hash Culture**
--------------------------


All Zero Hash employees are guided by the following characteristics and core principles:


* Independence/Ownership - An ability to work autonomously. Join Zero Hash, pitch ideas, and shape the work you do.


* Passion - We are innovating quickly and challenging the status quo. We want you to think big, be creative and make a difference every day.


* Collaborative - A good attitude and respect for others. We're teammates, not co-workers. Everything we do is a shared success and equally a shared failure - we talk in terms of “we” not “me”.


* Initiative - An ability and passion for learning and asking questions. We will champion you, challenge you and push you to achieve your best - and we expect you to do the same.


* Empathy - An ability to listen, respect, and understand your co-workers, customers, and everyone you interact with no matter how different they are to you.


* Adaptability - An ability to respond quickly. We are in a fast-paced industry and so we expect you to be creative when solving a new problem and comfortable under pressure.


* Transparency - We believe that transparency is critical to empowering everyone to make the best decisions, both the company to its people and vice versa.


* Integrity - Integrity creates trust. As both an organization collectively and as individuals, it is our most valuable asset.


Follow us


Twitter (https://twitter.com/ZeroHashX)


LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/company/zerohash)


Youtube (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8HvrzcqzbusQYyfzctl\\_VA)


Blog (https://blog.zerohash.com/)

  

  

For candidates based in Colorado, please contact colorado-wages @zerohash.com to request compensation and benefits information regarding a particular role(s). Please include with you email the city you reside (or intend to reside in Colorado) and the title/link to the roles you're interested in.

title: Product Designer
description:
Product Designer  

  

You must be able to attend meetings between 8 AM and 11 AM CST, Monday - Friday.  

You must speak and write fluent English. We use chat and Jira for most of our communication. We write product requirements.  

  

**Project Requirements:**  

IDERA is a data-driven software company. Our product line consists of enterprise-level SaaS and Desktop applications for databases, developers, and testing. Our software is mature with a well-established user base.  

  

IDERA is currently looking for a Product Designer with strong UX and UI design skills. Who can improve our DevOps desktop and web enterprise applications and interactions without overhauling the UI. Who is sensitive to  

the user's current workflows and has experience with micro changes through multiple iterations.  

  

**What You’ll Be Doing:*** Work closely with the Director of UX/UI Design, product managers, architects, and developers to improve our Tools experiences through research and application of UXD best practices.
* Perform heuristic analysis, UI design audits, and product walkthroughs.
* Define and develop key interaction models, workflows, and wireframes.
* Create high-fidelity mockups and prototypes.
* Present designs to the management and product team and be able to explain design choices.
* Work within and help update multiple products' existing style guides, component libraries, icons, and other documentation.
* Assist the Product Manager with developing the Product Requirements Document for a product release by placing PNGs of mockups in the document, adding captions under each mockup, verifying the copy matches all the interactions and follows the mockups, and adding the boilerplate statement.
* Handoff files to developers using Zeplin.io
* Attend developer demos and QA the user interface to ensure designs were implemented correctly.
* Create a list of UI design improvements and defects for a product release during the QA stage.
* Work within and help refine product design system guidelines.
* Follow Idera processes.


  

**Must Haves:*** 2+ years of user experience, not including schooling.
* Outstanding portfolio showing hands-on UX track record.
* Experience designing for enterprise web applications, big data, and data visualization.
* Proven history of improving user workflows and interactions.
* Expert knowledge of Interaction Design, UI Design, User Experience best practices, usability principles, and frameworks.
* Extensive experience building and rapidly iterating on wireframes, mockups and prototypes.
* Experience competitor analysis and heuristic analysis.
* Knows when to apply best practices and when to perform user research.
* Expert at using prototyping tools such as Sketch and Figma.
* Experience preparing files for development handoff using 3rd party redlining tools like Zeplin.
* Should be able to create Pixel Perfect mockups and know how to use Figma libraries, symbols, text styles, and layer styles.
* Experience working remotely and freelance.
* A self-starter, who is used to being the sole UX designer.
* Able to multitask and work on multiple products at once.
* Requires very little direction.
* Excellent communicator (written and verbal) in English.

**Preferred skills:*** Design experience for enterprise desktop applications with extensive data and IDE.
* Basic knowledge of Dev Ops, Development, Database development, management, and monitoring products including performance management and administration solutions.
* Some basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript programming experience.
* BA degree in HCI, Interaction Design or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.

**Please note, this is not a visual design or development position.**
An Equal Opportunity Employer - All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Creative Marketing Designer
description:
**ABOUT US**
============


MindsDB is a fast-growing open-source company that enables developers to quickly integrate Artificial Intelligence Logic into applications and ship AI-powered solutions from prototyping & experimentation to production in a fast & scalable way.

MindsDB was founded in 2017 by Adam Carrigan (COO) and Jorge Torres (CEO) and based in San Francisco, California, is backed with over $55M in total funding from Mayfield, Benchmark, YCombinator, OpenOcean, Walden Catalyst Ventures, MMC, Speedinvest, TQ Ventures and the University of California Berkeley SkyDeck fund. MindsDB is also recognized by Forbes as one of America's most promising AI companies (2021) and by Gartner as a Cool Vendor for Data and AI (2022).

**THE ROLE**
============



We are seeking a creative, versatile design dynamo to join the marketing team at our fast-paced startup.



As the Creative Marketing Designer, you will be responsible for developing compelling visual storytelling and eye-catching assets that effectively communicate our brand message. Blogs + white papers, event banners, short videos, the occasional hoodie? It should all engage our target audiences across various digital and traditional marketing channels.



This role requires a blend of creativity, technical proficiency, and thinking on your feet to deliver impactful designs that drive brand awareness and support our marketing objectives.

  


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**
========================


* **Conceptualize and Design Marketing Materials:** Collaborate with the marketing team to conceptualize and design a wide range of marketing materials, including but not limited to, digital ads, blog and YouTube covers, social media graphics, email templates, print collateral, infographics, presentations, and website assets.
* **Web Design**: translate design concepts into user-friendly and visually appealing web interfaces. Create mockups, wireframes, and prototypes for our website, landing pages, and other online assets. Ensure designs are responsive and optimized for various devices and screen sizes.
* **Brand Alignment:** Ensure all designs align with our brand guidelines and maintain a consistent visual identity across all marketing touchpoints.
* **Creative Strategy:** Contribute to the development of creative strategies and campaigns by bringing fresh ideas and innovative design concepts to the table.
* **Visual Storytelling:** Translate marketing objectives and messaging into visually engaging narratives that resonate with our target audience and drive brand engagement.
* **Market Research:** Stay informed about industry design trends and emerging design techniques to continuously improve the effectiveness of our marketing designs.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, content, and product teams, to understand project requirements and deliver high-quality designs that meet business goals.
* **Iterative Design Process**: Embrace feedback and iterate on designs to ensure continuous improvement and alignment with project objectives and stakeholder expectations.

  


**REQUIREMENTS**
================


* Bachelors or Masters degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in Graphic Design, with a focus on marketing and web design.
* Demonstrated experience in web design principles, including responsive design, user experience (UX) best practices, and web styling via HTML and CSS.
* Proficiency with graphic/web design tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite and other relevant design tools.
* Strong portfolio showcasing a diverse range of design projects, with an emphasis on marketing materials and campaigns.
* Excellent understanding of typography, color theory, layout principles, and visual hierarchy.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to articulate design concepts and rationale effectively.
* Experience in designing for IT or Artificial Intelligence projects.

  


**NICE TO HAVE**
================


* Hands-on experience with Webflow is a plus.
* Experience with motion graphics, video editing, or UX/UI design is a plus.

**Salary Range**


$90,000—$120,000 USD

title: Product Designer (Contract)
description:
We are seeking a User Experience Designer to join our team. In this role, you will be skilled at each stage of the design process, designing experiences that allow customers to intuitively use our products.



Your job is cross-functional; you will collaborate with product and engineering to solve business problems, meet user needs, and innovate. You will rely on both qualitative and quantitative data to make informed decisions. You will bring a background in design thinking, business acumen, and an aptitude for problem-solving. As a member of the team, you should have a passion for collaborating and be open to following the product development process. This role is an 8 month contract position.


**The impact you'll have:**


* Deliver innovative product designs that solve new business problems
* Modify and revise existing designs to meet changing customer needs
* Collaborate with cross-functional team members in product and engineering
* Brainstorm design ideas to inform the product development process
* Create wireframes and prototypes that drive ideations, support user testing, and become part of a design spec for engineering to build
* Gather and incorporate stakeholder feedback
* Collect and interpret both qualitative and quantitative feedback
* Participate in, and assist with, user research activities
* Follow brand, visual, and content style guidelines
* Set UI requirements in detailed design specs
* Coordinate with other design team members to ensure consistent and accurate communication
* Work closely with Product to identify opportunities to improve the product
* Work closely with product engineers and provide assistance when needed
* Present product design ideas to cross-functional teams and leadership


**What you'll bring:**


* 3+ years experience in a UX product design role
* Expertise in Figma
* A well-rounded portfolio of work, demonstrating a strong understanding of user objectives
* Familiarity with design thinking user-centered design and other principles. Proven success in all phases of the design process.
* Familiarity with the product development process
* Knowledge of user research and user testing methods
* Awareness of user reactions and responses to products
* An intuitive eye for customer needs beyond the obvious
* Creative thinking and problem-solving skills
* Analytical mentality that prioritizes research and data
* Strong attention to design principals and detail
* Up to date on industry trends and market conditions
* Passion for design; not satisfied with the status quo and always thinking of ways to improve
* Awareness of new tools and technologies
* Ability to effectively communicate and persuade others around design concepts
* Dynamic, creative personality, effective at engaging and influencing a variety of audiences
* Empathy and understanding of the K12 market - you do not need to be an expert, but any experience that will help you relate to these users is a plus

U.S. Pay Range
$30—$45 USD
Please note that the compensation information is a good faith estimate, and is provided pursuant to Equal Pay Laws. SchoolStatus intends to offer the selected candidate base pay dependent on job-related, non-discriminatory factors, such as experience. Our team will provide more information about the total compensation package for this position during the interview process.


#### **What we do:**



SchoolStatus is more than just an EdTech company—we're reshaping the future of K-12 education. Our fast-growing teams are dedicated to transforming education through innovative communications, attendance management, and teacher development solutions for schools, districts, and families.



We deeply value diversity and are dedicated to fostering an inclusive environment for all our employees. We believe that exceptional candidates bring unique perspectives and skills that enable us to best meet our mission of supporting student success. If you believe you have the potential and passion for a SchoolStatus role, we encourage you to apply—and join us to make a meaningful impact on the future of education!

title: Graphic Designer & Illustrator
description:
About You


Are you a top-notch visual artist with a passion for design?


Do you have experience with graphic design & illustration?


Do you thrive in a digital marketing environment?


If you answered YES! to all the above, GREAT! You’re exactly who we’re looking for!


About Us


ClickGUARD is an AdTech cybersecurity platform that is trusted by thousands of customers worldwide to protect and secure their digital marketing funnels, sites, and paid traffic source from bots and fake users. We’ve built the absolute best solution for a significant problem affecting PPC advertisers globally, and we look forward to having you join us in taking it to the next level.

**How we work**
---------------


We focus on talent rather than location to hire the very best for every role. Open communication is vital, and we use the best tools to collaborate efficiently. We are a remote-first company where everyone has the autonomy to create their best work.


Role Overview:


We are seeking a highly skilled and creative Graphic Designer & Illustrator to join our dynamic marketing team. The ideal candidate will be adept at translating complex ideas into visually compelling assets, with a focus on social media campaigns, ad visuals, blog banners, sales collateral, reports, infographics, and short animation videos.


About the role


* Conceptualize and design visually engaging graphics for various social media platforms to support marketing campaigns.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure brand consistency across social media channels.
* Create eye-catching visuals for online advertisements, ensuring alignment with the overall campaign messaging.
* Design brochures, presentations, one-pagers, and other sales assets that engage prospects and drive conversions.
* Optimize ad visuals for different platforms and formats.
* Design captivating banners and featured images for blog posts to enhance visual appeal and drive reader engagement.
* Develop visually stunning presentations, demos, and infographics for sales and marketing teams.
* Design email templates that align with the brand and enhance the effectiveness of email campaigns.
* Design compelling visuals for presentation and documents to communicate complex information in a clear and visually appealing manner.
* Create informative and visually appealing infographics that convey key messages and data points effectively.
* Produce concise and engaging animated videos to support marketing campaigns and product promotions.
* Collaborate with the marketing and content teams to script, storyboard, and execute animated video projects.


What qualifies you for this role?

* 3+ years of experience as a Graphic Designer & Illustrator, preferably in the SaaS or tech industry.
* Extensive portfolio showcasing expertise in social media graphics, ad visuals, blog banners, sales collateral, reports, infographics, and short animation videos.
* Proficiency in graphic design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects).
* Strong understanding of design principles, typography, and branding.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team and translate complex concepts into visually appealing assets.
* Experience with animation software and video editing tools is preferred.
* Knowledge of UI/UX design principles is a plus.

What’s in it for you?


Competitive salary


Work that fits your personality and lifestyle


Your hours are flexible, and so is your vacation


Any equipment/software/tech that you need to do your job


You can work from anywhere in the world - We work remotely!


Once a year all expenses paid company get-togethers


How to Apply


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

**\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*PLEASE NO RECRUITERS OR AGENCIES\\*\\*\\*\\*\\***


  
About UsClickGUARD is an AdTech cybersecurity platform that is trusted by thousands of customers worldwide to protect and secure their digital marketing funnels, sites, and paid traffic source from bots and fake users. We’ve built the absolute best solution for a significant problem affecting PPC advertisers globally, and we look forward to having you join us in taking it to the next level.


How we work
------------


We focus on talent rather than location to hire the very best for every role. Open communication is vital, and we use the best tools to collaborate efficiently. We are a remote-first company where everyone has the autonomy to create their best work.

title: Mid-Level UX/UI Designer
description:
**Company Overview:**


At FWDthink we are at the forefront of technological innovation, committed to securing the digital frontier for businesses and government entities alike. With a mission rooted in excellence, integrity, and innovation, we've achieved notable success in delivering cutting-edge cybersecurity solutions. Our culture is one of collaboration, empowerment, and continuous learning, where every team member's contribution is valued and drives our shared success. We use authenticity, simplicity & kindness to enable talent & service. Our model focuses on moving the mission forward and encourages experimentation, expression the disruption of paradigms that no longer serve the greater good. We are creative, nurturing and innovative. We are a company of creators with evolving interests. We think forward by aligning our resources, tools, and strategies to focus on the solution. Join us as we encourage and empower our employees!

 **Description:**


We are seeking a talented Mid-Level UX/UI Designer to join our innovative design team. In this role, you will be responsible for creating user-centered designs that deliver exceptional and intuitive experiences for our customers. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including product managers, developers, and researchers to gather insights, understand user needs, and translate them into elegant design solutions. The ideal candidate is a creative thinker with a passion for user-centered design and a strong portfolio of digital design projects.

 **Key Responsibilities:**


Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to define project requirements and goals. Assist in creating user-centered designs that enhance the user experience and usability of products. Conduct user research and gather insights to inform design solutions. Create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups to communication design concepts. Iterate on designs based on feedback from users, stakeholders, and team members. Collaborate with developers to ensure the implementation of


designs is consistent with the original vision. Drive the design process by contributing innovative ideas and solutions. Stay up-to-date with design trends and industry best practices to continuously improve design processes and outputs

 **Qualifiers:**


U.S. Citizen and active U.S. Secret security clearance required. Bachelor's degree in Design, human-computer interaction, or a related field. 3+ years of experience in UX/UI design, preferably in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Adobe XD, Sketch, or Figma. Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and methodologies. Ability to work well independently as well as in a collaborative team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Excellent communication, collaboration and presentation skills. Attention to detail and ability to meet tight deadlines. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively.

title: Lead Product Designer
description:
**About Lyra Health**
Lyra is transforming mental health care through technology with a human touch to help people feel emotionally healthy at work and at home. We work with industry leaders, such as Morgan Stanley, Uber, Amgen, and other Fortune 500 companies, to improve access to effective, high-quality mental health care for their employees and their families. With our innovative digital care platform and global provider network, 10 million people can receive the best care and feel better, faster. Founded by David Ebersman, former CFO of Facebook and Genentech, Lyra has raised more than $900 million.  

Lyra Health is looking for an exceptional Lead Product Designer to help craft solutions across the highest impact moments in a member’s mental health journey to search for care. As a product designer at Lyra, you’ll drive initiatives to successful outcomes for users and the business by approaching problems holistically with speed and simplicity to elegantly solve multi-faceted, complex problems that help members get started with Lyra.  

  

This role will be a part of the Client Enrollment team, which supports a member’s first encounter with Lyra from registration to booking with a provider. As a member of this team, you’ll work from idea to implementation alongside product designers, product managers, engineers, clinicians, and executives to introduce and unlock access to mental health care for millions of users worldwide.  

This role can be carried out from our Burlingame, CA headquarters, hybrid, or fully remote/virtually. Remote candidates must be physically located within the United States.
### **Responsibilities**

* Own the end-to-end user journey from ideation to final production on the Client Enrollment team
* Influence the shape of the product with research and data while executing designs using high-quality wireframes, user journeys, cross-platform interactive prototypes, and pixel-perfect visual designs
* Design experiences across all of our platforms: iOS, Android, Web
* Participate in design critiques and present work regularly in stakeholder feedback meetings
* Evaluate design opportunities through business goals, UX research, competitive audits and data insights
* Intuitively know when to expedite initiatives vs when to spend the extra time to deliver the largest impact
* Leverage intuition and experimentation when the full design process can’t be run
* Build relationships with cross-functional team members across disciplines, and effectively speak to process, goals, and team vision
* Present to Lyra’s leadership with confidence while moving quickly with a rapid experimentation mentality
* Partner with engineers as they build and ship solutions
* Balance member and business goals
* Contribute to Lyra’s holistic design system

### **Qualifications**

* 8+ years of experience working in UX, UI, HCI related field with experience working on mobile
* Proven track record of working within a product team to ship successful products to users
* Experience implementing design systems across a range of platforms in an iterative software development environment
* Highly proficient with design tools (Figma, Principle, etc)
* Ability to think big and understand complex feature sets, shaping design for multi-disciplinary projects
* Mastery of design craft
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to work well on a highly collaborative and cross-functional team
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment
* Motivated by partnering with leadership and comfortable with rapid changes in direction to determine the most optimal path forward
* Portfolio of UX-focused work samples for web and mobile applications
* Bachelor's degree in graphic design, visual communication, HCI, or equivalent practical experience

### **Diversity & Inclusion at Lyra**

* Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) at Lyra is essential to the way we deliver culturally responsive care, build and manage our provider network, and support holistic efforts to strengthen DEIB in workplaces around the world—including our own.
* People come to Lyra with a range of needs, backgrounds, and abilities that influence their response to mental health support. Our diverse network of providers delivers comprehensive mental health treatment and support rooted in culturally responsive care, a multicultural approach that accounts for the impact of cultural backgrounds on each person’s care experience. Learn more at https://www.lyrahealth.com/diversity-equity-inclusion-belonging/


As a full-time Lead Product Designer you will be employed by Lyra Health, Inc. The anticipated annual base salary range for this full-time position is $149,000 - $205,000. The base range is determined by role and level, and placement within the range will depend on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to your skills, qualifications, experience and location. This role may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses.  

Annual salary is only one part of an employee’s total compensation package at Lyra. We also offer generous benefits that include:* Comprehensive healthcare coverage (including medical, dental, vision, FSA/HSA, life and disability insurances)
* Lyra for Lyrians; coaching and therapy services
* Equity in the company through discretionary restricted stock units
* Competitive time off with pay policies including vacation, sick days, and company holidays
* Paid parental leave


401K retirement benefits* Monthly tech stipend
* We like to spread joy throughout the year with well-being perks and activities, surprise swag, free food and snack deliveries each month, regular community celebration…and more!

  

We can’t wait to meet you.
#LI-REMOTE  

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information or any other category protected by law.  

By applying for this position, your data will be processed as per Lyra Health Workforce Privacy Notice. Through this application, we will collect personal information from you including your name, email address, gender identity, employment information, and phone number for the purposes of recruiting and assessing suitability, aptitude, skills, qualifications, and interests for employment with Lyra. We may also collect information about your race, ethnicity, and sexual orientation, which is considered sensitive personal information under the California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA). Providing this information is optional and completely voluntary. If you are a California resident and would like to limit how we use this information, please use the Limit the Use of My Sensitive Personal Information form. This information will only be retained for as long as needed to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, as described above. Please note that Lyra does not “sell” or “share” personal information as defined by the CPRA. For more information about how we use and retain your information, please see our Workforce Privacy Notice.

title: Frontend Developer (Graphics Designer + UI/UX)
description:
**About Us:**

MYSITES Global is a leading provider of innovative cloud services, committed to delivering exceptional user experiences and cutting-edge design. We are seeking a talented Frontend Developer with a unique combination of Graphics Design and UI/UX skills to join our dynamic team. If you are passionate about creating visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces for cloud services, we want to hear from you.

**Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with the design and development teams to understand project requirements and translate concepts into visually stunning, responsive, and intuitive user interfaces.
* Develop HTML/CSS templates and pages for our cloud service, ensuring cross-browser compatibility and optimal performance.
* Utilize your graphic design skills to create captivating visuals, icons, and other graphical elements that enhance the overall user experience.
* Implement responsive design techniques using Bootstrap to ensure seamless functionality across various devices and screen sizes.
* Employ Sass to maintain a modular and scalable codebase for easier maintenance and updates.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest UI/UX trends, tools, and technologies to continually enhance the user interface and experience of our cloud service.
* Work closely with the backend development team to integrate frontend components with server-side logic.
* Conduct thorough testing and debugging to identify and fix any issues promptly.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as a Frontend Developer with a strong portfolio showcasing both graphic design and UI/UX work.
* Proficient in HTML, CSS, and SASS with a deep understanding of responsive design principles.
* Hands-on experience with Bootstrap, including grid systems and responsive design components.
* Expertise in Material Design principles and implementation.
* Strong knowledge of cross-browser compatibility and accessibility standards.
* Ability to take design concepts and turn them into functional, pixel-perfect HTML/CSS templates.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Problem-solving attitude and a keen eye for detail.

**Education and Experience:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Web Development, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in frontend development and graphic design.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: From $30.00 per hour

Compensation package:

* 1099 contract

Experience level:

* 2 years

Schedule:

* Day shift

Experience:

* CSS: 2 years (Required)
* HTML: 2 years (Required)
* Responsive web design: 2 years (Required)
* SASS: 2 years (Preferred)
* Graphic design: 2 years (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

Work Location: Remote
