title: Sr UX Designer
description:
Overview:
**We are*****CONNECTING HEALTH AND WEALTH.*****Come be part of remarkable.** **How you can make a difference**
Come help us drive and improve our users' experience and have a measurable impact across the design of our products and services.

  



As a Sr. UX designer, you will gain a solid understanding of our product offerings and the end-to-end user experience (covering portals and mobile applications) to guide and inform design decisions and desired user outcomes. You will be part of a core team of designers that do research and design in close collaboration with product teams and engineering to solve complex problems and deliver intuitive, engaging experiences.

  

The ideal candidate for this role should be able to connect the dots between business needs, innovation, and good user-centered design practices while executing design solutions throughout the entire product lifecycle.

  

**What you’ll be doing*** You will design and launch features that engage, empower, and delight our users.
* Collaborate with product teams to understand specific objectives and lead design efforts to tackle complex problems and produce innovative solutions.
* Facilitate design workshops and lead design sprints to foster collaboration and ideation within the team.
* Demonstrate mastery of common visual and interaction design principles and practices, and create suitable sketches, wireframes, flows, design comps, and prototypes with autonomy.
* Consistently produce clear and compelling materials and narratives explaining design rationale to all teams using customer, business, and competitive insights.
* Be a constant advocate for the user and own the persona development, user journey creation, and ongoing experience assessment.
* Actively seek feedback on design work and plan to address it in your iterative process proactively.
* Clearly communicate context, user-centric goals, and objectives considering the audience when presenting work.
* Integrate data-driven insights into the design process, leveraging analytics and user feedback to inform and optimize user experiences.
* Partner and collaborate with engineers and product managers to ideate solutions and ensure designs are technically feasible and drive desired outcomes.
* Maintain a value-driven mindset, highlighting the design's impact across the product organization.
* Staying up-to-date with competitor products and industry trends

 **What you will need to be successful*** Proven experience as a UX designer in leading parts of the product design cycle for customer-facing applications and working with cross-functional teams.
* Strong competency in human-centered design practices, interaction design, information architecture, and prototyping
* Experience facilitating design workshops and leading design sprints
* Experience designing dashboards, contributing to the visualization and presentation of complex information.
* Impeccable attention to detail and high-quality craft in UI design.
* Expertise in design, collaboration, and prototyping tools (Figma & FigJam)
* Capable of analyzing user data and synthesizing findings into actionable insights to guide design decisions and inform others.
* Clear and confident communicator with an affinity for storytelling and presenting findings with visual clarity.
* Knowledge of accessibility guidelines and experience designing products following accessibility standards and compliance (WCAG)
* Experience with responsive web design and mobile-first design.
* Experience with Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) is a plus, bringing a deeper understanding of intelligent technologies to enhance user interactions.

*#LI-Remote**This is a remote position.*
Salary Range: $99500.00 To $120,000.00 / year Benefits & Perks:

The compensation range describes the typical minimum or maximum base pay range for this position. The actual compensation offer is determined based on job-related knowledge, education, skills, experience, and work location. This position will be eligible for performance-based incentives as part of the total compensation package, in addition to a full range of benefits including:
* Medical, dental, and vision
* HSA contribution and match
* Dependent care FSA match
* Uncapped paid time off
* Adventure accounts
* Paid parental leave
* 401(k) match
* Personal and healthcare financial literacy programs
* Ongoing education & tuition assistance
* Gym and fitness reimbursement
* Wellness program incentives

HealthEquity has a vision that ***by******2030 we will make HSAs as wide-spread and popular as retirement accounts.*** We are passionate about providing a solution that allows American families to connect ***health and wealth***. Join us and discover a work experience where the person is valued more than the position. Click here to learn more. **Come be your authentic self**
HealthEquity, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, age, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a qualified individual with a disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. title: Sr. Digital UX Designer
company: Volkswagen Group of America - Chattanooga Operations
description:
**Sr. Digital UX Designer**


 - EA 000316 - Fully Remote
Primary Location United States-EA Home Based  

Electrify America is committed to revolutionizing the way people charge. As the country's largest open DC fast charging network, Electrify America is actively contributing to electrifying mobility today and building a more sustainable future.  



At Electrify America, we value innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to sustainability. We strive to establish a diverse and inclusive workplace where employees can develop personally and professionally. As a team member at this rapidly growing company, you can work on state-of-the-art technology and join a team making a significant impact in the world. If you're interested in joining a dynamic, innovative company, Electrify America is a place where you can learn, grow, and make a difference!

**Role Summary:**

The Digital UX Designer is responsible for the creation of intuitive, user-centric software experiences that improve the user experience with our applications and brand. The ideal candidate will be adept at understanding user needs by conducting thorough research, analyzing analytics, and translating findings into compelling design solutions. In this role, you will work closely with Product, Software Development, and Marketing teams and be responsible for creating user experience designs for mobile and web applications. Designs and protypes will be created in Figma and you will work with the software development team to ensure that they have the design necessities to implement the designs you create for our products.
**Role Responsibilities:**
**Design Creation, Execution and Leadership** (70%):


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and design user interfaces for web and mobile applications.
* Support the strategic vision of a project by aligning creative decisions with overarching goals and objectives
* Work closely with the team to understand project requirements, develop design concepts, and produce high-quality assets within established brand and development guidelines.
* Lead the design and development of user interface components, ensuring they are visually appealing and user-friendly.
* Create wireframes, prototypes, and mockups to communicate design concepts effectively.
* Conduct user research, usability testing, analyze user behavior using analytics, and gather feedback to make data-driven design decisions.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to ensure the latest design practices are applied.
* Leverage research and analytics


**Collaboration and Communication** (20%):


* Effective collaboration is crucial for success in this role.
* Foster an environment of problem solving and innovation
* Help bridge the gap between creative teams and technical and non-technical stakeholders
* The designer will spend a significant portion of their time interacting with team members to gather input, exchange ideas, and ensure alignment.
* Clear and concise communication will be necessary to understand project briefs, present design concepts, incorporate feedback, and provide updates on progress.


**File Management and Documentation** (5%):


* The designer will be responsible for organizing and maintaining design files and related documentation.
* Establishes official artifacts (Figma, Zeplin, Figjam, File Naming, etc.)
* This includes properly archiving project assets, naming conventions, version control, and ensuring easy accessibility to team members.
* Keeping design files and documentation well-organized helps streamline workflow and facilitates collaboration within the team.


**Skill Development and Learning** (5%):


* Continuous learning and skill development are important for a designer's growth.
* Allocating a portion of the bandwidth to explore new design techniques, stay updated with industry trends, and seek feedback from mentors and peers will contribute to professional development and enhance design capabilities.
* Studies the latest trends, design, and technologies
 **Years of Relevant Experience:**


* 7+ of relevant experience in design


**Education (Required):**


* Bachelor’s Degree in User Experience, Graphic Design, Computer Science, or a related field
* Other bachelor’s degree with strong proven design expertise


**Education (Desired):**


* Provide portfolio of existing work


**Skills:**



Resourceful, flexible and results oriented with a positive attitude and the ability to contribute in a highly collaborative environment


**Software UX Design:** The ability to think creatively, generate innovative ideas, and translate concepts into compelling visual and animated designs is essential. As a designer, you will be responsible for creating wireframes, prototypes, and mockups to communicate designs effectively to business stakeholders and developers.


**User Research and Analyzing User Analytics:** As a designer, you may be asked to help conduct user research, usability testing, and gather feedback to help make design decisions for our products. In addition to user research, the Digital UX Designer will leverage data from analytic tools such as Google Analytics to help make design decisions is also expected.


**Brand Strategy and Consistency****:** As a senior designer, you'll be responsible for ensuring brand consistency across various touchpoints by using and contributing to our design library and visual element specs.


**Project Management****:** As a designer, you may have increased ownership over projects and be responsible for managing them from start to finish. Acquiring project management skills, such as setting timelines, defining project scopes, coordinating with stakeholders, and ensuring timely delivery, will be beneficial for effectively handling multiple design projects simultaneously.


**Collaboration**: Focuses on being a world-class individual contributor and demonstrates grace during difficult situations.


**Communication and Presentation:** Senior designers should have exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively convey design concepts and ideas to clients, stakeholders, and team members. They should be adept at creating visually compelling presentations and articulating design decisions confidently and persuasively.


**Attention to Detail****:** Having a meticulous eye for detail is crucial to ensure accurate and high-quality design deliverables. Paying attention to small details such as alignment, consistency, and grammar helps maintain brand integrity and professionalism.


**Flexibility****:** The ability to adapt to changing priorities, work well under pressure, and handle feedback and revisions with a positive attitude is important. Flexibility in adjusting design approaches based on project requirements and evolving marketing strategies is valuable in this dynamic role.


**Continuous Learning****:** A growth mindset and a willingness to continuously learn and improve are highly valued. Staying updated with design trends, industry best practices, and new design tools and techniques is crucial for professional growth and staying competitive.


**Specialized Skills (Required):**


* Experience with Design software (i.e. Zeplin, Figma )
* Experience with project management tools (Monday.com, JIRA, etc.)
* Ability to create digital prototypes for mobile apps and web applications.
* Champions design principles
* Time management and multitasking abilities
* Creativity skills and problem-solving aptitude
* Understand project requirements and concepts
* Collaborate with team members to launch projects, provide feedback and guidance for junior designers
* Ability to leverage research and best practice in design work
* Ability to effectively present creative work and pitch suggestions
* Take a needs-first approach to innovation


**Specialized Skills (Desired):**


* Experience with EV charging
* Experience with Google Analytics


**Work Flexibility:**


* Role may be fully remote or hybrid in the Reston, VA area. If fully remote, candidate will be expected to travel to Reston, VA office one week per month
* In addition, domestic travel for site visits, conferences, trainings, etc., may be required; estimated at 0-5%


*Electrify America is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome and encourage applicants from all backgrounds, and do not discriminate based on race, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, color, gender identity/expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by applicable laws.*

*Salary range is dependent on factors such as geographical differentials, industry-based experience, skills, training, credentials, and other qualifications.*

*In the state of California, the salary range is $**110,300* *- $14**8**,**9**00.*

*In the state of Colorado, the salary range is $**110,300 - $148,900.*

*In the state of Washington, the salary range is* *$**110,300 - $148,900.*

*In New York City, the salary range is $1**32,400* *- $1**78,700**.*

*In Westchester County, the salary range is* *$**132,400 - $178,700.*

*In the state of Rhode Island, the salary range is* *$**110,300 - $148,900.*

title: UX Designer
description:
Blackpoint Cyber is the leading provider of world-class cybersecurity threat hunting, detection and remediation technology. Founded by former National Security Agency (NSA) cyber operations experts who applied their learnings to bring national security-grade technology solutions to commercial customers around the world, Blackpoint Cyber is in hyper-growth mode, fueled by a recent $190m series C round.


As a UX Designer at Blackpoint Cyber, you will be a key part of our Product Organization of a global Product Design team collaborating closely with product managers, engineers, and QA to deliver the best possible experience for our customers. This is a great opportunity for those with a passion for User Experience and Design.

 **About Blackpoint Cyber Design:**


Blackpoint believes the User Experience is an equal partner with product management and engineering. This means designers own the user experience solution for any project. We look for full stack designers who can bring leadership from the conception phase through the final rollout. Design at Blackpoint drives innovation, inspiration, and the future of the product. Craftsmanship, attention to detail, flexibility, and love for great products binds us together as a team.

 **What You'll Do:**

* Understand project goals to deliver high quality design specs in a timely fashion.
* Partner with product management and engineering to execute on all projects.
* Scope project work and understand the tradeoffs between short-term delivery needs and long-term product goals.
* Consider and seek out potential additional use cases beyond a single project when deciding to expand upon existing templates and patterns.
* Produce high-quality creative solutions to complex problems based on research and goals.
* Create clear user flows, specs, and prototypes for user interfaces.
* Use storytelling concepts that bring the user and problem to solve to the forefront when sharing design work.
* Organize content and information and expand existing components with a focus on user goals, usability, and accessibility.
* Promote the use of our design system to ensure product consistency.
* Provide input for members of the team through work reviews, documentation, and technical guidance.
* Develop knowledge of all Blackpoint features and services to drive consistency and cohesive solutions.

 **What You'll Need:**

* A minimum of 5 years of experience designing enterprise cloud-based solutions.
* Ability to lead ideation activities within an already defined scope.
* Talent for making multi-step user tasks easy to navigate and complex data easy to use.
* Ability to create and design for user personas.
* Experience in end-to-end user experience processes and workflows, including user journeys, task analysis, information architecture, wireframing, prototyping, and evaluative research methods.
* Strong use of design artifacts to effectively build alignment, communicate ideas, and deliver an experience.
* Experience in using Figma.
* Some experience in enterprise SaaS products.
* Outstanding collaboration and communication skills in verbal and written formats.
* Online portfolio.

 **Bonus Points:**

* Knowledge of the cybersecurity industry, especially detection and response
* Experience with design systems and platform design work.


Blackpoint Cyber welcomes and encourages applications from qualified individuals of all races, colors, religions, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment.


We thank everyone for their interest, but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Product Designer
description:
We are seeking a mid/senior Product Designer to join our Product team. This will be the second design hire in our organization as we strive to establish a strong design presence at Spectora.
### **Description**


### **About Spectora**


Spectora is the leading SaaS home inspection platform, with a 7-year track record of helping home inspectors build successful businesses through our world-class inspection software. Our flagship product is an all-in-one business solution that helps inspectors conduct and share inspections, manage and automate their operations, and market their business.  

We’re proud to say Spectora is the market leader in the home inspection space, an achievement possible because of our fanatical focus on our customers, product, and team. We go head-to-head with bigger competitors with deeper pockets every day and are winning.  

And we win because of our people.  

Our culture is driven by our scrappy, hilarious, and relationship-focused team, who bring IQ and EQ to the table. We push ourselves and each other to grow in our careers and as people and are focused on being the best versions of ourselves every day. Spectora is a genuinely exceptional place to work (if we do say so ourselves). **Want to hear about our culture directly from the team?**https://youtu.be/ticzqdTGAlo### **About the Position**


We are seeking a mid/senior Product Designer to join our Product team. This will be the second design hire in our organization as we strive to establish a strong design presence at Spectora.  

To succeed in this role, you should be highly collaborative, kind, and flexible. Having a sense of humor doesn’t hurt either. We are constantly evaluating and improving our product and processes, so if the idea of being part of that excites you, please continue reading.  

In addition to working closely with the design lead, you will collaborate with the Product and Engineering teams to create a cohesive, engaging, and user-friendly experience across our platform.### **Core Responsibilities**

* Design and validate new experiences via mockups, wireframes, flow diagrams, sketches, and other Product Design artifacts for our web and mobile applications
* Create low-fi mockups and high-fidelity designs that can be leveraged by Product and Engineering teams
* Work as an embedded member of a cross-functional product development team, collaborating with Product Managers and Engineers to set the product's strategy, and create solutions based on research
* Help build and evolve our fledgling design system
* Conduct research and usability tests with users, both in-person and online
* Advocate for the user and evangelize user experience throughout the organization

### **Who You Are**

* You enjoy stepping out of your comfort zone. Being design hire #2 on our team means you have an opportunity to help shape how design plays into other aspects of the organization
* You constantly analyze and obsess over other products' experiences. We realize the importance of user experience to a successful product and are invested in being the category leader
* You have 5+ years of experience designing world-class SaaS products, B2B SaaS is preferred
* You have a strong portfolio of design work including both web and mobile applications
* You're an excellent communicator with a proven track record presenting designs and articulating design decisions to both cross-functional teams and stakeholders
* You have a strong aptitude for performing and synthesizing research
* You have a bias towards action, and know-how to succeed in ambiguity
* You’re self-aware and lead from a place of empathy
* You have the ability to make data-driven decisions and champion the best outcomes for customers
* You're proficient in Figma

 *We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every bullet point. We are people, not checklists, and we hire as such!* *Application Instructions:* **Portfolio required -** Please include a link to your portfolio showing examples of the following for *both web and mobile*, if possible:* Wireframes/low-fidelity mockups
* Interactive prototypes
* High-fidelity designs

 **Want to go the extra mile or make your resume stand out? Email jobs@spectora.com with your CV and a personalized note or video on why you'd be a great fit.** *Show us who you really are. We want to get to know YOU!*  

This is a fully remote position, although we will prioritize Denver based candidates given equal qualifications otherwise!  

Salary: $110,000 - $130,000 per year with a competitive benefits package  

Benefits:* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* Short and long term disability insurance
* Life insurance
* Unlimited PTO

 *Spectora values and celebrates a diverse workforce. We strongly encourage women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants, free of discrimination or harassment.*
#### **Salary**


$110,000 - $130,000 per year

title: Product Designer
description:
BellXcel is looking for a Product Designer, passionate about contributing to our mission and purpose by creating delightful and intuitive experiences for our customers. You will be working on Arly by BellXcel, a digital tool that empowers youth-serving organizations to create high quality programs. You will work closely with other designers, product managers, engineers, and others to deliver solutions that meet our customers needs. You will report directly to the Lead Product Designer.

 **Position Accountabilities**

* Own end-to-end design by leveraging your design thinking, product, interaction, and visual design skills to create experiences that empower customers
* Drive the design process from discovery to implementation, knowing what approach to take based on the problem space
* Conduct user research, usability testing, and gather feedback to iteratively improve the user experience and validate design solutions
* Partner with product managers, engineers, and other designers to create a product from the initial definition to shipping and ensure a consistent experience across the product
* Maintain design consistency across the product, contributing to an evolving design system
* Fluency in best practices for user interface design, information architecture, and interaction design; ability to provide and effectively communicate strategic and tactical recommendations based upon research and data
* Ensure our product design reflects and reinforces the Arly brand

 **Desired Qualifications**

* 3-5 years of experience in a Product Design role
* A strong portfolio of case studies demonstrating a successful track record of human-centered design solutions that address strategic business problems
* Deep expertise in UI/UX craft; passion for visual design, interaction details, typography, and pixel-perfect deliverables
* Experience designing mobile and desktop SaaS and B2B2C
* Understanding of user-centered design principles and best practices
* Experience with user research methodologies and usability testing
* Experience with Figma
* Knowledge of capabilities and limitations of web technologies such as HTML, JavaScript, and CSS
* Innate curiosity and a craving for feedback to improve
* Ability to work in a dynamic environment — balancing rigor and scrappiness. You have a strong bias for action and focus on impact
* Experience creating and working with an evolving design system
* A highly collaborative approach to working with engineering and product teams
* Education/EdTech industry experience preferred

 **About Arly by BellXcel**  

Arly by BellXcel's software platform is the engine for youth programming. Built from decades of proven experience, Arly by BellXcel's time-saving digital tools power high-quality programs for youth-serving organizations so they can spend less time dealing with program logistics and paperwork, and more time focused on what truly matters most: elevating the potential of youth.

 **Perks & Benefits**

* Remote work environment
* Competitive salary
* Self-managed paid time off, which includes vacation, sick and personal time
* Opportunity to work in an entrepreneurial, mission-focused environment
* Typical benefits included: 401(k) with matching & comprehensive insurance including medical, dental, vision, and life

 ***All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.***

title: Brand Designer - US Remote
description:
Date: Mar 3, 2024
Location:
US
Company: Vista
**Our Team:**
-------------

Vista is transforming to become the go-to partner that helps small businesses design and market their services at every point along their journey. By providing a spectrum of design and marketing help — from the tools to create designs from scratch to the resources they need to get the right designs created for them — we’re becoming the expert design and marketing partner for small businesses.  




**What You Will Do:**
---------------------

We’re looking for a Brand Designer to join our Brand Creative team to help us bring out the best in small businesses everywhere. Reporting into our Brand Creative Director and collaborating closely with a global team of designers, UX designers, copywriters, photographers, production artists, and marketing partners, this role will be responsible for creating and scaling brand systems and concepting and designing best-in-class creative and marketing solutions.

  

**Responsibilities:**
---------------------

* Help evolve the VistaPrint brand via brand guidelines, visual elements and an eye for typography
* Support global campaign work by defining sales identities, campaign guidelines and toolkits
* Deliver striking visual design for sports partnerships and event creative from concept to execution
* Create and curate product designs and template libraries to feature in global campaigns
* Deliver high-quality work within fast-paced timelines, with quick turn-arounds
* Clearly and confidently present creative work
* Participate in team meetings and provide input on design-related projects & topics
* Drive excellence in quality, design, typography and brand consistency
* Champion design and marketing trends, using them as inspiration to shape creative work


**Your Qualifications:**
------------------------

At Vista, we are striving to hire individuals that add new ideas and perspectives to our teams and enhance our culture. No matter your background or work experience, we strongly encourage you to apply—even if you feel that you don’t meet the exact requirements or have the same qualifications. You might be a great candidate for this or other opportunities.

  


* 1-3 years of design experience in brand, advertising, or digital publishing. We’re open to all backgrounds, whether you’ve worked at in-house agencies, external agencies or freelance.
* An online portfolio of work showcasing design thinking and execution. **A portfolio is required to apply.**
* Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite. Familiarity with collaborative tools like Figma is a plus, but not required.
* Ability to work with project management tools, like JIRA.
* Experience with template libraries and an eye for organization and detail
* Excellent communication skills to clearly and effectively articulate design and creative choices.
* Strong collaboration skills – And the mindset that each project is a chance to collectively learn, grow and add something to the team.
* A passion for small businesses – And interest in their experiences, challenges and dreams.

**A portfolio is required to apply!**
-------------------------------------


**Why You'll Love Working Here:**
---------------------------------

There is a lot to love about working at Vista. We are an award winning Remote-First company. We’re an inclusive community. We’re growing (which means you can too). And to help orient us all in the same direction, we have our Vista Behaviors which exemplify the behavioral attributes that make us a culturally strong and high-performing team.  




**About Us:**
-------------

Vista is the design and marketing partner to millions of small businesses around the world. For over 20 years we’ve been inspired by small businesses, and we work incessantly to deliver solutions to their evolving needs. VistaCreate, 99designs by Vista and VistaPrint, all under the parent brand Vista, represent a full-service design, digital and print solution, elevating small businesses’ presence in physical and digital spaces and powering them to achieve success. Vista is focused on making great marketing and design accessible to every small business owner, allowing them to create a cohesive brand image for use in-store, online and on-the-go.

  

**Commitment to Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion:**
-------------------------------------------------


Vista exists to help our customers live their dreams. Each dream is unique – and the Vista team needs to be as well. We believe in the unique contributions of everyone within a diverse global organization. We are collaborative, inclusive, and innovative. We strive to role model and live an inclusive culture of fairness, respect and belonging for all. And we work together to empower each other, creating a space in which each of us can spark our next great idea.  




**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
-------------------------------

Vista, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

  




  

**Job Segment:** User Experience, Project Manager, Equity, Photography, Technology, Finance, Creative

title: Product Designer
description:
**Who is Blueprint?**



We are a technology solutions firm headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, with a strong presence across the United States. Unified by a shared passion for solving complicated problems, our people are our greatest asset. We use technology as a tool to bridge the gap between strategy and execution, powered by the knowledge, skills, and the expertise of our teams, who all have unique perspectives and years of experience across multiple industries. We're bold, smart, agile, and fun.


**What does Blueprint do?**



Blueprint helps organizations unlock value from existing assets by leveraging cutting-edge technology to create additional revenue streams and new lines of business. We connect strategy, business solutions, products, and services to transform and grow companies.


**Why Blueprint?**



At Blueprint, we believe in the power of possibility and are passionate about bringing it to life. Whether you join our bustling product division, our multifaceted services team or you want to grow your career in human resources, your ability to make an impact is amplified when you join one of our teams. You'll focus on solving unique business problems while gaining hands-on experience with the world's best technology. We believe in unique perspectives and build teams of people with diverse skillsets and backgrounds. At Blueprint, you'll have the opportunity to work with multiple clients and teams, such as data science and product development, all while learning, growing, and developing new solutions. We guarantee you won't find a better place to work and thrive than at Blueprint.



We are looking for a **Product Designer** to join us as we build cutting-edge technology solutions! This is your opportunity to be part of a team that is committed to delivering best in class service to our customers.



You'll be part of a team of creators who help people win the moment through great design, UX, video, and content that nurtures discovery, adoption, and engagement with Microsoft 365 products and services. The team culture is inclusive, entrepreneurial, curious, courageous, kind and collaborative.


**Responsibilities**:


* Participate in a cross-functional team to conduct a visual audit of learning and help experiences.
* Modernize learning and help touchpoints based on Microsoft design libraries, reusable coded components.
* Advocate for accessibility, diversity, and inclusion from ideation to implementation.
* Help to create a phased approach to roll out the new version of design library.
* Continue to evolve and refine design libraries for new touchpoints and emerging technologies.


**Qualifications:**


* 5+ years of creative leadership across a variety of touchpoints.
* Experience with creating, developing, and deploying a design system at scale.
* Excellent visual design, branding, identity, design systems, and storytelling skills.
* Experience with Figma, Adobe Creative Suite (Highly proficient), MS Office.
* Technical understanding of capabilities and constraints for platforms including web and native mobile (iOS and Android).
* Portfolio with examples incorporating illustration, sound, motion, and animation into a design system.
* Flawless attention to detail.
* Experience with social products, communities or instructional design is helpful.


**Salary Range**



Pay ranges vary based on multiple factors including, without limitation, skill sets, education, responsibilities, experience, and geographical market. The pay range for this position reflects geographic based ranges for Washington state: $73,100 to $88,500 USD/annually. The salary/wage and job title for this opening will be based on the selected candidate's qualifications and experience and may be outside this range.

title: Brand Designer
description:
Location: Remote — U.S. only


### **What are we doing at Uscreen?**


Uscreen is a profitable, growing, & bootstrapped SaaS business changing the way video-based entrepreneurs and creators monetize their content. Our all-in-one video membership platform empowers creators to generate revenue through subscriptions, communities, courses, and live-streamed events across various platforms (web, mobile, and TV).


We are seeking a talented **Brand Designer** to work with our creative team and help drive enhanced visuals throughout the company. The ideal candidate has experience with SaaS companies, and possesses the ambition to grow with us.


As a key player, you will work closely with teams, including Marketing, to help us establish Uscreen as an industry leader when it comes to creative content.


You’ll thrive in this role if you have a growth mindset. We value a knack for seeing things that others don’t and a strong attention to detail. Ideally, you’re excited by the prospect of getting to exercise your creative muscles while having the support of a strong, stable company and team.


### **What you’ll do**


* Helps ensure strategic, seamless experiences – working closely with marketing, sales, and more to elevate our global brand and optimize the customer journey end-to-end
* Refine visual language as an extension of the brand, including illustrations, icons, colors, typography, animations, logo design, color schemes, typography, and visual elements
* Serve as the primary designer for all brand collateral, including but not limited to the brand guidelines, website, pitch decks, one-pagers, case studies, infographics, social media assets, email templates, video assets, and more
* Create and implement strategies to enhance brand visibility and recognition
* Be an advocate for consistent and cohesive design throughout the company
* Contribute design thinking, brand experience, and design-driven storytelling
* Conduct market research as needed to identify trends and understand customer preferences
* Collaborate with the marketing team to understand objectives and develop design concepts for various initiatives such as product launches, campaigns, etc
* Presenting design concepts to stakeholders for review and feedback
* Stay up-to-date on the latest trends in design and technology and recommend ways to improve Uscreen’s online presence
* Enable other team members to create on-brand assets
* Evaluate the effectiveness of branding efforts and make recommendations for improvement in an effort to keep the brand relevant and relatable to our audience


### **Do you have what it takes?**


* 3-5 years of experience in brand design, preferably in a fast-paced creative environment
* Strong portfolio of work demonstrating creative thinking and executional excellence across a variety of mediums
* Strong understanding of design principles, typography, and color theory
* Effectively communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale
* Engage in constructive design critiques
* Able to work independently, prioritize accordingly, and iterate quickly
* Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite and Figma
* Experience with video production and/or animation is a plus!
* Excellent communication skills; ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams
* Open-minded about feedback and a willingness to grow and improve your work
* Preferred, but not required: Experience with UX design and web design
* Self-motivated and a thoughtful, yet quick problem solver
* Growth mindset and a positive attitude
* Knowledge of the Creator Economy

### **Our Commitment to You**


* We know your worth and will compensate you competitively.
* Our unlimited PTO policy encourages every team member to take the time they need to unwind and recharge.
* Your growth is our growth! We’ll provide you with access to best-in-class training, workshops, and conferences to help you develop and succeed in your role.
* It’s a marathon, not a sprint. We make sure you have a clear growth plan to help you get to the next level at Uscreen.
* 100% Remote – Work from wherever your heart desires, as long as you have access to stable internet and a conducive workspace.
* We also offer flexible parental leave.
* Your home office should be ergonomic and inspirational to help you make some magic ✨. We’ll give you a generous WFH stipend to help you set one up.
* And if WFH is not for you, we’re happy to pay for your coworking space.
* We’re proud to offer personal development and mental wellness stipend.
* We host virtual social events and company retreats filled with fun activities to ensure you feel part of the Uscreen family.


### **✔️****Are you interested in applying?**


* Fill out the short form
* We will review the applications and email candidates who qualify to set up a first-round interview

title: UX Designer (Remote)
description:
Job Description


The mission of the OFR is to support the Financial Stability Oversight Council (FSOC) in promoting financial stability by: collecting data on behalf of FSOC; providing such data to FSOC and member agencies; standardizing the types and formats of data reported and collected; performing applied research and essential long-term research; developing tools for risk measurement and monitoring; performing other related services; making the results of the activities of the OFR available to financial regulatory agencies; and assisting such member agencies in determining the types of formats of data authorized to be collected by such member agencies.


The UX Designer will participate in the design of digital products. Assist Senior Product Manager to interpret requirements and design digital interfaces or experiences.


Key Tasks and Responsibilities


* Lead the implementation of the 21st Century Integrated Digital Experience Act and U.S. Web Design System (USWDS) principles for existing and new, publicly facing data products


* As needed, work with project teams to translate general requirements into UX/UI specific requirements for financial monitors or other research/data related products.


* Develop UX workflow and process diagrams. Iteratively develop static and/or interactive mock-ups and prototypes of project features based on requirements and feedback. Mock-up and prototype formats can include but are not limited to: static PDFs, Wire-frame/Justinmind prototypes, or Adobe design files, etc.


* Consult and advise on usability of functional prototype versions developed by the project team.


* As needed, assist project team with style sheets, navigation design, and other UX/UI functionality including responsive design of products on desktop, phone, and tablet devices.


* As needed, compare new monitor UX/UI design capability with existing OFR monitors and against best practices and standards; and provide recommendations for improvements and consistency across products.


* Provide input related to ad hoc requests made by the data product manager, project lead, or IT project lead.


* Provide UX/UI support on existing and future tools, projects, and monitors.


* In addition to the financial monitor support, the UX/UI expert will need to review the OFR external website and provide feedback on how best to update it to account for new monitors. The UX/UI expert will need to work with the OFR external website team, a visual communications expert, a data product manager, and a user outreach specialist, among others.


* This review should include a full review of the research monitors and data products hosted on the OFR external website.


* Review the layout and design of the OFR external website providing feedback on the user interface/experience across different devices.


* Provide mock-ups and layouts for different webpages of public website.


* As needed, assist project team with style sheets, navigation design, and other UX/UI functionality.


* As needed, assist project team in developing presentational materials for internal and external stakeholder engagement and end-user feedback.


* Provide UI/UX support on existing and future tools, projects, and monitors.


* Design, prototype, develop, and implement a consistent user interface and experience across all OFR’s publicly facing data products


* Support & verify the implementation of Section 508 accessibility requirements in Data Product design and interfaces


* Assist with the redesign and implementation of OFR’s publicly facing website


* Provide guidance and assist with the implementation of data visualization best practices, interaction design (task flows, control layouts), and visual design (composition, typography, visual brand themes) for OFR’s data products


* Maintain working knowledge of web development tools & frameworks (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Confluence, Jira, etc.)


* Assist with user-acceptance testing of new design changes, enhancements, and product features


* Assist with usability best practices and content strategies



Job Requirements:



Education & Experience


* Bachelor’s degree


* 5 or more years of IT experience


* SharePoint experience required


* Excellent written and verbal communications


Certifications


* Atlassian/JIRA Administration—desired


* Other UX/UI relevant certifications- desired


Security Clearance


* Must be able to obtain a US Treasury Public Trust clearance.

Other (Travel, Work Environment, DoD 8570 Requirements, Administrative Notes, etc.)


* This position is currently full remote, but in the future, could require occasional days in the US Treasury offices.

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
**About Openmesh and Xnode**



Today a handful of corporations control 90% of the world's data and IT infrastructure and we are expected to trust them. This is not just bad for business; it's bad for everyone. Information asymmetry has led to social inequality, scandals, polarization, and corruption. Sometimes, it has even led to war. Centralized data control acts as a potential chokepoint for innovation, raises privacy concerns, and creates a bottleneck for the free flow of data.



Openmesh is a cutting-edge new open-source cloud infrastructure and a global open data network aimed at storing important global data without a middleman. It is the largest open web3 data lake, covering approximately 80% of the entire crypto and web3 ecosystem today. In 2023 and 2024, we aim to expand our data coverage to include public health and scientific research data.



Openmesh enables anyone to create their own decentralized data cloud, connect globally, share data securely, slash deployment costs, and automate data cloud setup. The Openmesh Network is designed to collect, store, process, stream, and provide data connectivity for anyone, anywhere, anytime, without the need for registration, licensing, or payments. Think of Openmesh as the internet's open data fabric. It grants universal access and prevents interferences created by regulators, governments, corporations, and even its own creators. The possibilities are endless.


**Core Products**



Our flagship product, Xnode, is an integral part of this vision, offering a revolutionary platform for developers to build decentralized data clouds. Xnode, enables developers to build their own decentralized data clouds with data connectivity, data APIs, and query & analytics engines in mere minutes, instead of weeks or months. They pay only for computing and storage, sidestepping licensing and setup fees. Xnode facilitates a 10-15 fold cost reduction in running and operating data clouds and can save over 95% of deployment time.



Pythia is a powerhouse analytics & query engine that transforms raw data into actionable insights. Pythia allows anyone to design, build, visualize, and deploy powerful data products.



Unified APIs provide a single endpoint for all crypto & web3 data, making it accessible to anyone, anywhere, without any costs. There are no licenses, registrations, or setup fees involved.


**Our vision**



Our vision is to democratize data and address information asymmetry at a scale. Data & information is the most valuable commodity in the world. Without quality, reliable data, all webpages, apps, and the entire internet will stop working. We believe access to reliable, unedited information is a fundamental right- an aspect of a free and democratic society. The Core Principles of Openmesh, by design, has no single authority that can alter its data, how the information is distributed or controlled, or who can see what and when. The infrastructure and entire technology stack is open-source and governed by an open-source community.


**About the Role**



As a Senior UI/UX Designer, you will drive design innovation for decentralized platforms within Xnode and Pythia, ensuring user-centric and visually appealing experiences for the open web3 data network.


### **Your Impact**


* Lead the innovation of UI/UX designs for decentralized platforms within the Xnode and Pythia ecosystems.
* Collaborate with development teams to ensure seamless integration of design concepts.
* Integrate user feedback into design iterations, ensuring continuous improvement.
* Lead the organization in design innovation for decentralized platforms, setting new standards.
* Ensure seamless integration of design concepts into Xnode and Pythia products, enhancing overall user experience.
* Uphold user-centric excellence in design, contributing to the success and popularity of decentralized applications.


**Key Responsibilities & Qualifications**


* Bachelor's or Master's degree in UI/UX Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field.
* Proven experience in UI/UX design for decentralized platforms.
* Strong proficiency in design tools such as Sketch, Figma, or Adobe XD.
* Proven leadership skills, with experience in guiding high-performing teams towards complex project delivery.
* Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.
* Strategic thinker with a knack for identifying industry trends and integrating them into product development.


**Why Join Us**


* Lead a revolutionary product that is reshaping the landscape of data management and accessibility.
* Collaborate with a global community of innovators and thought leaders in the decentralized space.
* Make a significant impact on how data is accessed and utilized worldwide, promoting transparency, efficiency, and democratization.
* Enjoy a dynamic, challenging, and rewarding work environment, along with competitive compensation and benefits.


How to Apply: Interested candidates should submit a resume and a cover letter detailing their passion for decentralized technologies and their vision for Xnode's future.

title: UX Designer
description:
Job Description:

Netimpact is looking for a user-experience (UX) designer able to understand our business requirements and any technical limitations, as well as be responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mockups and prototypes. The UX designer will also be expected to design the overall functionality of the product, and in order to ensure a great user experience, iterate upon it in accordance with user-testing. **Responsibilities*** Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
* Facilitate the client’s product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products.
* Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
* Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.
* Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.
* Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.
* Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
* Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.


Qualifications:
**Requirements*** Four or more years of UX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments.
* Expertise in standard UX software such as Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer, and the like is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.
* Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.
* Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.
* A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.
* Ability to apply UX designs to Enterprise Software platforms such as ServiceNow
* Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.
* Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.
* A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking.
* Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.
* Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.
* Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.
* Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.
* Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies.


About Us:
*Perks of working at NetImpact Strategies** Your health comes first – we offer comprehensive medical, dental, & vision insurance that starts the first of the month after you join the team
* Invest in your future – 401(k) Plan – Immediately vested employer contributions; no matching required
* Work hard, play hard – we offer a generous Paid Time Off (PTO) policy and observe ALL ten (10) federal holidays
* Pawsitively pawesome – Pet Insurance (because our little critters are part of our families, too!)
* Invest in your education – Tuition reimbursement, internal training programs, & company-sponsored industry certifications
* Be part of a dynamic and collaborative work environment recently ranked by The Washington Post as a Top Work Place in 2019 & 2020!
* Have fun and celebrate and give back – Team building activities, community volunteering, quarterly HQ days, & an offsite annual awards banquet

**ABOUT US**
NetImpact Strategies Inc. (NetImpact) has been a Trusted Advisor driving impact through digital transformation for the Federal Government for over a decade. We solve complex problems with innovation and agility to create meaningful, transformative, and enduring change. As Trusted Advisors, NetImpact professionals partner with customer agencies to deliver solutions that empower them to not only meet their missions but also realize their strategic vision through agile, outcome-focused solutions addressing both strategic and tactical requirements. We design and implement comprehensive, tailored solutions that are both mindful of the client's culture and organizational dynamics. NetImpact’s core values and commitment to a customer and results-oriented delivery approach has propelled our growth and enabled us to deliver impactful value across Strategic Consulting, Process Automation, Cloud, DevSecOps, Data and Analytics, and Cyber Security for the Federal Government. **ACCESSIBILITY NOTE**
NetImpact Strategies is committed to complying with all applicable provisions of the Americans with Disabilities Act, as amended (“ADA”), and applicable state and local laws. It is NetImpact’s policy not to discriminate against any qualified person or applicant with regard to any terms or conditions of employment on the basis of such individual’s disability. Consistent with this policy of non-discrimination, NetImpact will provide reasonable accommodations to an individual with a disability, as defined in the ADA or applicable law, who has made NetImpact aware of his/her disability, unless doing so would cause undue hardship to NetImpact. If you are an applicant and need reasonable accommodation when applying for job opportunities within NetImpact, or request reasonable accommodation to utilize NetImpact’s online employment application, please contact careers@netimpactstrategies.com. **EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**
NetImpact is committed to the development of a creative, diverse, and inclusive work environment. In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at NetImpact will be based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. NetImpact does not discriminate against any person because of race, color, creed, religion, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation, and pregnancy), marital status, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, and local laws (referred to as "protected status").

title: User Interface Designer
description:
At DuPont, we are working on things that matter; whether it’s providing clean water to more than a billion people on the planet, producing materials that are essential in everyday technology devices from smartphones to electric vehicles, or protecting workers around the world.


If you would like to be a part of a premier multi-industrial company that is delivering sustainable solutions that bring real purpose and value, of a company with collaborative spirit because it believes that we work best when we work together as a team and values the diversity of thought, then DuPont is the company for you!

**WHY JOIN US?**

**Our purpose is to empower the world with essential innovations to thrive. We work on things that matter!**


Have the **Opportunity** to chart your own course, challenge yourself, and acquire new capabilities to build a rewarding and fulfilling career. We reward employees with competitive pay and incentives to recognize skills, competencies, and contributions to business results.


Get to **Experience** a collaborative environment where teamwork is celebrated with flexibility that enhances balance and an inclusive atmosphere that is welcoming to all!


Get to know our **Purpose** and make it yours by bringing innovations to market that improve the world, share a commitment to sustainability that makes our planet better and give back to communities in which we work and live.


Job Description UI/UX Designer  

  

DuPont Water Solutions (DWS) is on a digital transformation journey to design and develop innovative digital products and services that drive value for customers and other stakeholders. This includes using connecting plants using IOT and leveraging AI/ML to deliver descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytics. We are looking for future leaders who are willing to take roll up their sleeves and define, design, and develop the next generation products and services that will power innovation and growth for DWS.  

  

We are looking for a Product Designer who can transform our software into user-friendly products that delight our clients. Product Designer responsibilities include gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. We're looking for individuals who are well-versed in the latest industry trends, emerging design patterns, and ever-evolving technologies. If you have a portfolio of professional design projects that include work with web/mobile applications, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you’ll create both functional and appealing features that address our clients’ needs and help us grow our customer base.  

  

Objectives of the role:


Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers. Conduct user research to understand needs, behaviors, and pain points of users through interviews, surveys, and observations. Organize and structure content and information logically, ensuring easy navigation. Identify and troubleshoot UX problems for existing products. Conceptualize and illustrate ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps. Create mockups, wireframes, and interactive prototypes to visualize the layout and functionality of digital products. Craft visually pleasing interfaces and graphic designs, including choosing colors, typography, icons, and imagery, while maintaining consistency with branding guidelines. Develop and maintain Design Library including extensive list of UI components and patterns. Conduct usability tests to gather feedback and iterate on designs for improved user satisfaction. Define how users interact with the product, including the placement and behavior of interactive elements. Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as developers and product managers, to ensure designs align with technical feasibility and business goals. Design interfaces that adapt seamlessly to different screen sizes and devices. Create user guides, documentation, and in-app help and take in charge on interface content.


Skills:

* 6-8 years of proven work experience as a Product Designer or similar role.
* A strong portfolio showcasing previous design work, including web/mobile applications, design process, problem-solving abilities, and creativity.
* Proficiency in design software and prototyping tool such as Adobe Creative Suite (e.g., Photoshop, Illustrator, XD) Figma, Sketch etc.
* Knowledge of user-centered design principles, typography, color theory, and layout are essential.
* Strong team spirit and communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders. Effective time management skills to meet project deadlines and handle multiple tasks efficiently.
* A basic understanding of front-end development can be beneficial. A keen eye for detail to ensure that designs are pixel-perfect and consistent.


Education Qualification:

**B.Des / M.Des** Degree is mandatory.


Join our Talent Community to stay connected with us!


DuPont is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability or any other protected class. If you need a reasonable accommodation to search or apply for a position, please visit our Accessibility Page for Contact Information.

title: User Interface Designer
description:
We are looking for a dynamic UI/UX designer who will be responsible for the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design of our various digital assets. You will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design. You will come up with creative solutions to UI/UX design problems by staying up to date with best practices and emerging trends in user experience design and user interface technology.

Roles and Responsibilities

Investigating user experience design requirements for our suite of digital assets.

Developing and conceptualizing a comprehensive UI/UX design strategy for the brand.

Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes.

Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.

Testing UI elements such as CTAs, banners, page layouts, page designs, page flows, and target links for landing pages.

Collaborating with the marketing team, and internal and external designers to ensure the creation and delivery of tailored experiences for the digital user.

Providing advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities in order to analyze and predict user behavior.

Adhering to style standards in typography and graphic design.

Lead UI/UX initiatives

Skills and qualifications

A bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 6 month internship-2 years UI/UX design experience for digital products or services.

A portfolio of professional UI/UX design work for both web and mobile platforms.

Working knowledge of the following technologies and software: Sketch, InVision,Figma, Visio, HTML, CSS (SCSS), iOS, Android, Design Systems, and Adobe Creative Suite.

A team player but can work independently too.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: ₹10,000.00 - ₹30,000.00 per month

Schedule:

* Day shift

title: User Experience Designer
description:
We are looking for a user-experience (UX) designer able to understand our business requirements and any technical limitations, as well as be responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mockups and prototypes. The UX designer will also be expected to design the overall functionality of the product, and in order to ensure a great user experience, iterate upon it in accordance with user-testing.

**Roles & Responsibilities**

* Experienced practitioner in different methods and end-to-end stages of UX lifecycle viz-a-viz: User and Stakeholder Requirements, Design and Prototyping and Usability Testing / Evaluation with some good case studies to his/ her credit.
* Demonstrate proficiency in UX deliverables like: User Journey Maps, Personas and Goals, Task Models and Information Models, User Flows, Wireframe Prototypes, Usability Testing
* Experience running UI/UX or human factors user studies measuring both qualitative and quantitative data
* Self-starter, self-motivated, able to work independently, and with minimal supervision
* Should have experience of working with agile development teams
* An excellent portfolio / case studies showcasing relevant UX work
* Multi-tasker who works efficiently under pressure, maintaining focus on the details"**.**

**Requirements**

- Expertise in standard UX software such as Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer, and the like is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.

- Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.

- A solid grasp of user-centred design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.

- A clear understanding of the importance of user-centred design and design thinking.

**What We're Looking For:**

* A portfolio that showcases your exceptional UI/UX design skills.
* Sample prototype with HTML/CSS/JS library
* Proficiency in Figma for collaborative design work
* A passion for crafting user-centric designs within a lightweight, minimalist aesthetic.
* Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with the team.
* An ability to work independently and meet project deadlines.

* Preferably a degree in Graphic Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or Any Graduate within a related field..
* Strong portfolio showcasing your UI/UX design and development work
* Expertise in design tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, or similar
* Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with experience in responsive design and mobile-first development
* Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and best practices
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively explain design decisions and concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Detail-oriented and highly organized, with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Flexibility in shifts would be a great advantage.

**A UI Designer’s Ideal Day At WWS** 

**Design Requirements.**

Design and develop visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces for SaaS applications, ensuring a seamless user experience.

Collaborate with the product management, development, and marketing teams to understand user needs, gather requirements, and translate them into functional designs.

Create wireframes, mockups, prototypes, and user flows to effectively communicate design ideas and concepts to the team.

Utilize best practices and design principles to ensure consistency across all products and platforms.

Conduct user testing and gather feedback to identify areas for improvement and optimize the user experience.

Stay up-to-date with the latest UI/UX design trends, techniques, and technologies to ensure our products remain cutting-edge and competitive in the market.

Assist in the creation and maintenance of design systems and style guides to streamline and standardize the design process.

**Tailored Requirements.** To collaborate with the product development team and its stakeholders to ensure the creation and delivery of tailored experiences for the digital users. Testing UI elements such as layouts, navigations, tabs and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience.

**User Research.** Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and management, Conduct user research and evaluate user feedbacks for better experience and aesthetic improvements.

**Prototype & test.** Prototyping to showcase the design interactions in real-time and also for testing on real time feasibility. Testing helps find weaknesses in the design and ensures that the final product meets projected expectations.

**What You Can Expect**

* Full-time, salaried position creamed with welfare programs.
* Competitive salary and module specific training in the core space with recognition potential and annual bonus.
* Performance appraisals.
* Attendance Incentives.
* Working with the best talent in the industry
* Conducive intangible environment with dynamic benefits.

**Why Consider a UI Designer Career With WWS?**

With a very appealing work environment at WWS, our setting made it easier to build relationships with other staff members and clients. You may also have an opportunity to learn other aspects of medical office work on the job, which can enhance your experience and qualifications.

UI designers are the bridge between user needs and business outcomes. They help to gather requirements and develop designs for different platforms or devices that work in tandem with engineers' wireframes and codebase implementation plans; they also provide feedback on these decisions through sketches & prototypes.

**Applications are welcome from fresh graduates too!!**

Please attach your resume and let us know through email your current address, phone number, and the best time to contact you by phone.

**Apply To this Job**

title: User Interface Designer
description:
**Founded in 2013, Instantpay** is a trailblazer in the digital financial domain, dedicated to equipping businesses of all scales with advanced banking and financial solutions. This dynamic platform integrates banking, payments, collections, expenses, and developer APIs, offering a one-stop solution for modern financial needs.

  

At its core, Instantpay features a current account, ensuring effortless fund management for businesses. The platform excels in efficient payout and collection systems, simplifying monetary transactions. Its expense management tool aids businesses in monitoring and managing expenditures effectively. Understanding the significance of rewards, Instantpay presents customizable gift cards for both corporate and personal purposes. Addressing the financial hurdles businesses encounter, we offer working capital loans to ensure uninterrupted operations. For those aiming to incorporate Instantpay's prowess into their infrastructure, robust APIs facilitate seamless integration, amplifying functionalities.

  

In summary, Instantpay isn't merely a financial platform but an all-encompassing ecosystem addressing diverse financial requirements, catering to both individuals and businesses.

  

We are seeking a highly creative and talented UI/UX Designer to join our Marketing department. The ideal candidate should have 1 to 2 years of experience in UI/UX design and a strong understanding of marketing principles. The UI/UX Designer will be responsible for creating visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces for our digital platforms, ensuring an exceptional user experience that aligns with our brand image.

 **Roles and Responsibilities:**

* Create visually appealing experiences that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation.
* Design customer experience designs for our FinTech platform (Web (responsive) & Mobile Experiences).
* Get familiar with design-based innovation approaches to solve customer challenges.
* Be a part of a fast-paced team that leads the innovation charge for its services business.
* Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with reporting managers and tech team.
* Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps.
* Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets.
* Build page navigation buttons and search fields.
* Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like.
* Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables) and help Graphic team in designing the graphics as well.
* Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders.
* Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness).
* Content layout adjustments based on user feedback.
* Adhere to style standards on fonts, colors and images.

 **Desired Skill & Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Fine Arts.
* Strong visual or interaction design skills.
* 1-2 years of relevant experience in design for web/mobile apps (high-end UI/UX designs).
* Fluency in mobile based information architecture and design, as well as strong knowledge of usability principles and techniques.
* Good to have knowledge of human-computer interaction (HCI), Visual Design, and Interaction Design.
* Proficiency in Sketch, Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator or any other UI and Graphics designing software.

 **Soft skill set :**

* Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.
* Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to management and teams.
* A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking.
* Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.
* Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.
* Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.
* Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.
* Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies.

  

Join our dynamic team and contribute to the creation of captivating and engaging user experiences that drive our marketing efforts. Apply now and be part of our innovative journey!

title: User Interface Designer

1. Creating designs for products on mobile and web

2. Understanding requirements from the product team and converting them into user flows

3. Designing wireframes, visual designs, and prototypes

4. Testing the design accuracy of the engineered output

**Job brief**

We are looking for a UI/UX Design to turn our software into easy-to-use products for our clients.

UI/UX Designer responsibilities include gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. To be successful in this role, you should have experience with design software and wireframe tools. If you also have a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with web/mobile applications, we’d like to meet you.

Ultimately, you’ll create both functional and appealing features that address our clients’ needs and help us grow our customer base.

* Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
* Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets

* Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
* Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)
* Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders
* Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)
* Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
* Adhere to style standards on fonts, colours and images

* Portfolio of design projects

* Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Figma, Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
* Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders

As an advanced web and software development company in Australia, **O360 solutions** is focused on helping its clients to stay aligned to their growth goals with disruptive solutions. With end-to-end web design and development, digital marketing, Ecommerce consultation, integration, custom software development, and more, we are the destination for your innovation needs in the digital ecosystem.

**Job Description**

title: Graphic Designer
description:
**Job Purpose:**

The graphic designer and video editor will play a vital role in the company's visual branding efforts. Collaborating with various teams, they will create engaging designs and edit videos that align with the company's branding strategy.

**Job Duties:**

* Designing and producing visual assets, including banners, social media graphics, brochures, and videos for training, branding, and marketing materials.
* Utilizing design software to produce high-quality graphics and videos.
* Ensuring all designs maintain a consistent visual identity and align with brand guidelines.
* Collaborating with different teams to understand their design and videography needs and deliver compelling visuals and videos accordingly.
* The task involves creatively editing and modifying existing content to align with marketing and branding goals.
* Staying updated on design trends, tools, and industry best practices for graphic design and video editing.
